front.gametext: Dark:  Deploys only if Death Star II system on table. Your TIEs at Death Star II locations may not Tallon Roll. Your non-Objective cards with 'Occupation' in title are canceled.  Light:  When your starship moves from here, draw movement destiny. Add maneuver (if any). If total destiny < 1, starship is lost.

front.title: •Death Star II: Docking Bay
front.gametext: Dark:  Your TIEs deploy -1 here. Your docking bay transit from here is free.  Light:  Your docking bay transit to or from here requires 8 Force (ignore other docking bay's text).

combo: Death Star II: Docking Bay + Lieutenant Endicott

front.title: •Death Star II: Reactor Core
front.gametext: Dark:  Deploys only if Capacitors on table. You may deploy That Thing's Operational from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Ominous Rumors is suspended.  Light:  When attempting to 'blow away' Death Star II, add 1 to total destiny for each of your piloted starfighter here.

front.title: •Death Star II: Throne Room
front.gametext: Dark:  Once per game, you may take Emperor's Power into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Light:  Immune to Revolution.

front.title: •Death Star Reactor Terminal
front.gametext: Deploy on table. X = number of your devices on table. Once during your turn, may peek at the top X cards of your Force Pile and take one into hand, or deploy from Reserve Deck (reshuffle) (or deploy from Lost Pile) a device (except Restraining Bolt or Tractor Beam). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Death Star has many terminals coupled to the main reactor for power distribution throughout the immense space station.

front.title: •Death Star Sentry
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any Death Star site. Declare one of the following to affect that site and adjacent sites while 'sentry' present: Opponent's deploy +1. OR Opponent's ability required for battle destiny +1. OR Your total power +1.
front.lore: Death Star troopers on sentry duty observe and direct incoming starships and monitor other critical sites. They perform sensor scans for life forms and weapons.

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe

front.title: •Death Star Sentry (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. Colo Claw Fish is canceled. Opponent must first use X Force to deploy a non-unique card (except a Jawa) to a location, where X = the number of copies of that card at that location.
front.lore: Death Star troopers on sentry duty observe and direct incoming starships and monitor other critical sites. They perform sensor scans for life forms and weapons.

front.title: •Death Star Sentry (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. Colo Claw Fish is canceled. Opponent must first use X Force to deploy a non-unique card (except a Jawa) to a location, where X = the number of copies of that card at that location.
front.lore: Death Star troopers on sentry duty observe and direct incoming starships and monitor other critical sites. They perform sensor scans for life forms and weapons.

front.title: Death Star Tractor Beam
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on Docking Bay 327. At the end of a battle at Death Star system, may target an opponent's starship present (except a Mon Calamari star cruiser) using 2 Force. Draw two destiny. Target captured if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: 'Why are we moving towards it?'

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe
canceledBy: Death Star: Central Core game text when controled by the Light Side

front.title: Death Star Trooper
front.gametext: Deploy only on Death Star, but may move elsewhere. Power -1 at a site other than a Death Star site.
front.lore: Elite soldiers trained in combat techniques and weapons skills. Devin Cant augmented security personnel guarding Princess Leia in Detention Block AA-23.

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe

front.title: •Death Star: Central Core
front.gametext: Dark:  If you control, Wrong Turn and Retract The Bridge deploy for free.  Light:  If you control, Force drain +1 here and Death Star Tractor Beam is canceled.

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe
cancels: Death Star Tractor Beam if Light Side controls this site

front.title: •Death Star: Central Core (V)
front.gametext: Dark:  May deploy Superlaser from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  At 'blown away' systems, adds one [Light Side] and one [Dark Side].  Whenever you Force drain at a 'blown away' system Death Star orbits, may retrieve 1 Force.  Light:  Opponent's Force drain bonuses at systems (except your systems) are limited to 1.  Immune to Expand The Empire.

front.title: •Death Star: Conference Room
front.gametext: Dark:  If you control, with a leader here, may add 1 to total of Commence Primary Ignition.  Light:  Force drain +1. If you control, may subtract 1 from total of Commence Primary Ignition.

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe

front.title: •Death Star: Conference Room (V)
front.gametext: Dark:  While you occupy two non-Death Star battlegrounds and your total influence here is > 5, you lose no Force to Visage of the Emperor.  Light:  While opponent has total influence > 5 here, your Sense and Alter destiny draws are +2.  [Virtual Block 4] Laser Gate is Immune to Sabotage.

front.title: •Death Star: Detention Block Control Room
front.gametext: Dark:  If you occupy with an Imperial, this site may not be converted.  Light:  If you control, you may raise converted Detention Block Control Room to the top.

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe
cards.counterpart: Death Star: Detention Block Control Room
combo: Death Star: Detention Block Control Roomr + Lt. Shann Childsen

front.title: •Death Star: Detention Block Corridor
front.gametext: Dark:  Add 1 to each of your weapon destiny draws here.  Light:  If you control, Force drain +1 here.

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe
combo: Death Star: Detention Block Corridor + Lt. Shann Childsen
Death Star: Detention Block + IT-O (Eyetee-Oh)

front.title: •Death Star: Docking Bay 327
front.gametext: Dark:  Your docking bay transit from here is free.  Light:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe

front.title: •Death Star: Docking Control Room 327
front.gametext: Dark:  If you control, may deploy a docking bay directly from your Reserve Deck. Reshuffle deck.  Light:  If you control, with a Rebel with ability > 2 present, Force drain +2 here.

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe
combo: Death Star: Docking Control Room 327 + Lt. Pol Treidum

front.title: •Death Star: Level 4 Military Corridor
front.gametext: Dark:  During your move phase, Imperials may move free from here to any one Death Star site.  Light:  If you control, Force drain +1 here.

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe

front.title: •Death Star: War Room
front.gametext: Dark:  If you control, with a leader here, all Rebel Troopers and YWings on table are forfeit -1.  Light:  If you initiate a battle here, add one battle destiny.

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe

front.title: •Death Star: War Room (V)
front.gametext: Dark:  If Alderaan 'blown away,' your movement to and from Death Star system is free, and at Death Star sites, your Force drains and battle damage against you are canceled.  Light:  This site is never a battleground.  You may not limit Force generation at mobile locations (except Executor sites).  [Virtual Block 5] Wipe Them Out, All Of Them is canceled.

front.title: •Death Star: War Room (V)
front.gametext: Dark:  Krennic deploys free here. Opponent may not limit Force generation at Death Star locations.  Light:  If a system was just 'blown away' by Superlaser, you lose 3 Force.

pulledBy: Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe

front.title: •••Death Trooper (V)
front.gametext: While you have no other trooper here (except death troopers), adds one battle destiny at same site as Krennic, Tarkin or Thrawn. May place this character in Used Pile to cancel a just drawn weapon destiny targeting your leader here.
front.lore: Stormtrooper

front.title: Debris Zone
front.gametext: If an AT-AT, an AT-ST, Jabba's Sail Barge or Planet Defender Ion Cannon has just been lost at a site, draw destiny. All cards with that destiny number at that site are lost.
front.lore: A reactor core explosion in a destroyed AT-AT causes a plasma release which shatters its armor, showering the immediate area with molten projectiles.

front.title: Debris Zone (V)
front.gametext: Once per turn, may take one Crash Landing or Weapon Malfunction into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR if you have a piloted AT-AT on Hoth, target artillery weapon at a related site is lost. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: A reactor core explosion in a destroyed AT-AT causes a plasma release which shatters its armor, showering the immediate area with molten projectiles.

front.title: Deep Hatred
front.gametext: Deploy on table. You may not play Sniper or You Are Beaten. During any deploy phase, you may place one card face-down under one of your Dark Jedi. (These are that character's combat cards.) No character may have more than two combat cards at once. Instead of drawing lightsaber combat destiny or duel destiny, your participating character may use one of his combat cards. Place character's combat cards in owner's Used Pile when used (or if that character leaves the table).

front.title: Deep Hatred (V)
front.gametext: Unless your [Reflections III] Objective on table, deploy on table. Vader's Obsession may be played to initiate an epic duel as follows: If Mara is present with Luke, each player draws two destiny (if armed with a lightsaber, each destiny is +1). Add character's ability. If Karrde on table, your total is -1. Higher total wins. If Luke loses, place him out of play and you may retrieve 5 Force. If Mara loses, cross her to the Light Side (she is now Mara Skywalker). Unless duel canceled or tied, for remainder of game any Mara is ability = 6, adds one battle destiny, and once per battle involving her, may cancel one just drawn destiny.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Logan Suriano - 2005 New Year's Resolution Contest)

front.title: •••Defel
front.gametext: Under 'nighttime conditions,' may use 1 Force to 'hide' (exclude himself) from a battle. While at a site affected by Revolution, opponent must lose 1 Force during your control phase.
front.lore: Male Defel from Af'El. This species, also known as 'wraiths,' is capable of warping light around themselves, becoming difficult to see at dusk.

combo: Defel(s) + Sunsdown + Chief Retwin

front.title: •Defense of Muunilinst
front.gametext: Deploy on War Has Begun. Unless a card stacked here, if you control three Muunilinst locations (and opponent controls no Muunilinst locations), opponent loses 1 Force (cannot be reduced) and stacks lost card here face down (Mission 'complete').

front.title: •Defensive Fire
front.gametext: Cancel Rogue Asteroid, OR Randomly select one card from opponent's hand and place it, unseen, in Used Pile.
front.lore: 275 gunners manning 60 turbolaser batteries provide a wide firing arc. Even so, asteroids are a challenge due to the sluggish recharge rates of the high-powered blasters.

combo: Defensive Fire + Limited Resources
Defensive Fire + Scanning Crew

front.title: •Defensive Fire & •Hutt Smooch
front.gametext: USED: Randomly select one card from opponent's hand and place it, unseen, in Used Pile.  LOST: Capture one opponent's undercover spy ('cover is broken'). OR If opponent just deployed a spy to a site where opponent has no presence or Force icons, return spy to hand. Any Force used to deploy spy remains used and that card may not deploy this turn.

front.title: •Defensive Fire (V)
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated battle, you may immediately fire one non-lightsaber, non-Permanent weapon present in that battle once (for free), adding 2 to each of its destiny draws. That weapon may fire again this battle.
front.lore: 275 gunners manning 60 turbolaser batteries provide a wide firing arc. Even so, asteroids are a challenge due to the sluggish recharge rates of the high-powered blasters.

front.title: •Defensive Fire (V)
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated battle, you may immediately fire a non-lightsaber, non-[Permanent Weapon] weapon present (for free and each weapon destiny is +2). That weapon may fire again this battle.
front.lore: 275 gunners manning 60 turbolaser batteries provide a wide firing arc. Even so, asteroids are a challenge due to the sluggish recharge rates of the high-powered blasters.

front.title: Deflector Shield Generators
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on any Star Destroyer. Adds 2 to armor. If starship has immunity to attrition, also adds 2 to immunity.
front.lore: Located atop the superstructure of a Star Destroyer, the generator towers create an energy shield which repels solid objects and weapons fire.

front.title: Deflector Shield Generators (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on a Star Destroyer.  It is power and armor +2 and immune to attrition < 5.  During battle, Power Pivot is canceled and S-Foils is suspended.  May be forfeited (forfeit = 3) to Used Pile.  Once per turn, may deploy a TIE or non-unique Imperial here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Located atop the superstructure of a Star Destroyer, the generator towers create an energy shield which repels solid objects and weapons fire.

front.title: Deflector Shield Generators (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on a capital starship. Starship is power and armor +2 and immune to attrition < 5. May cancel Combined Attack or Power Pivot targeting this starship. Starfighters here may not 'attach.'
front.lore: Located atop the superstructure of a Star Destroyer, the generator towers create an energy shield which repels solid objects and weapons fire.

front.title: •Den Of Thieves
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Once per turn, you may cancel a Force drain by placing here from hand, one non-unique alien. Aliens may deploy from here as if from hand. (If Effect canceled by opponent, any aliens here may immediately deploy for free.)
front.lore: Jabba's Palace is considered a safe haven to many on the run. It is also widely known to provide luxurious accommodations to its welcomed guests.

front.title: •Den Of Thieves & •Special Delivery
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per turn, if Skyhook Platform on table and opponent just forfeited a character present with your slaver, may 'enslave' that character (stack character face down under Skyhook Platform). May place an 'enslaved' character in owner's Lost Pile to activate up to 3 Force. Once per turn, while Indentured To The Empire on table, may cancel a Force drain by placing here from hand any non-unique slaver. Slavers may deploy from here as if from hand. May not be canceled. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Den Of Thieves (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your aliens of ability < 3 may not have their forfeit values reduced. Your battle destiny draws are +1 where you have a character with 'plotting to kill Jabba' in lore. May lose 1 Force to raise your converted [Jabba's Palace] site to the top.
front.lore: Jabba's Palace is considered a safe haven to many on the run. It is also widely known to provide luxurious accommodations to its welcomed guests.

front.title: •Dengar
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Power +1 for each opponent's character present. While present, may reduce Han's forfeit to zero.
front.lore: Corellian bounty hunter. Assassin trained by the Empire. Has reflexenhancing cyber implants. Gravely injured during a swoop race in the crystal swamp of Agrilat. Blames Han Solo.

combo: Dengar + Luke? Luuuuke! + any (Rebel) Han Makes Rebel Han Lost. (Indiana Jones Jedi Knight)

front.title: •Dengar (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Deploys free aboard Punishing One, and while piloting it, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. At same site, Han's game text is canceled. Immune to Fallen Portal.
front.lore: Corellian bounty hunter. Assassin trained by the Empire. Has reflexenhancing cyber implants. Gravely injured during a swoop race in the crystal swamp of Agrilat. Blames Han Solo.

front.title: •Dengar (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Characters about to be 'hit' by Dengar may be captured instead. If Dengar is about to be 'hit' while escorting a captive, captive is hit instead. If Dengar just seized a Rebel or a smuggler, opponent loses 1 Force (2 if Han).
front.lore: Corellian bounty hunter. Assassin trained by the Empire. Has reflexenhancing cyber implants. Gravely injured during a swoop race in the crystal swamp of Agrilat. Blames Han Solo.

combo: Dengar + Luke? Luuuuke! + any (Rebel) Han Makes Rebel Han Lost. (Indiana Jones Jedi Knight)

front.title: •Dengar In Punishing One
front.gametext: Permanent pilot is •Dengar, who provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. When in battle, adds 1 to total battle destiny for each opponent's starship present. Cancels opponent's immunity to attrition here.
front.lore: Corellian starfighter. Dengar replaced its passenger capacity and TIE cannons with enhanced targeting systems. Allows Dengar to track and engage multiple enemies at once.

front.title: •Dengar With Blaster Carbine
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. Permanent weapon is •Dengar's Blaster Carbine (may target a character, creature or vehicle for free; draw destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if destiny +1 > defense value; may be fired twice per battle).
front.lore: Corellian bounty hunter. Skilled athlete. Expert shot. Has worked many times for Jabba the Hutt. Carries a long-standing grudge against Han Solo.

front.title: •Dengar With Blaster Carbine (V)
front.gametext: While opponent's [Reflections II] objective on table, adds one battle destiny.  Permanent weapon is •Blaster Carbine (twice per battle, may target a character or vehicle for free; draw destiny; target 'hit,' and its forfeit = 0, if destiny +1 > defense value).
front.lore: Corellian bounty hunter. Skilled athlete. Expert shot. Has worked many times for Jabba the Hutt. Carries a long-standing grudge against Han Solo.

front.title: •Dengar With Blaster Carbine (V)
front.gametext: While opponent's [Reflections II] objective on table, adds one battle destiny.  Permanent weapon is •Dengar's Blaster Carbine (twice per battle, may target a character or vehicle for free; draw destiny; target 'hit,' and its forfeit = 0, if destiny +1 > defense value).
front.lore: Corellian bounty hunter. Skilled athlete. Expert shot. Has worked many times for Jabba the Hutt. Carries a long-standing grudge against Han Solo.

front.title: •Dengar's Blaster Carbine
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on Dengar, 3 on your other warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value. If hit by Dengar, target's forfeit = 0.
front.lore: Rugged, reliable Valken-38 carbine. Excellent sniper's weapon in the hands of a competent marksman. Stolen from a victim when Dengar was working as an Imperial Assassin.

front.title: •Dengar's Modified Riot Gun
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on Dengar, or 5 on your other bounty hunter. May target a non-droid character using 3 Force. Draw destiny. Character immediately captured if destiny +3 > defense value.
front.lore: Originally at area-effect weapon. Modified by Dengar to concentrate on one target. Induces an extended period of unconsciousness.

front.title: •Deployment Orders
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  If your Landing Craft just landed, you may use 1 Force to deploy a [Presence] droid or Neimoidian aboard.  Once per turn, may use 1 Force; reveal a [Theed Palace] vehicle (or Landing Craft) from hand to take a [Presence] droid pilot into hand from Reserve Deck (or vice versa) and deploy both simultaneously; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The amount of time it takes for a subcommand to transfer to an officer battle droid, and then to the rest of his regiment, is .396 of a second.

front.title: <>Desert
front.gametext: Dark:  May not deploy to Bespin, Coruscant, Dagobah, Hoth, Kessel or Naboo. Your Jawas and Tusken Raiders may deploy here. Sandwhirl here moves only if on Tatooine.  Light:  May not deploy to Bespin, Coruscant, Dagobah, Hoth, Kessel or Naboo. Each of your battle destiny draws is -1 here. Sandwhirl here moves only if on Tatooine.

front.title: •Desilijic Tattoo
front.gametext: Deploy on your Hutt. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one Jabba's Influence or Death Mark from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at Audience Chamber, no battles or Force drains may take place here unless a Rebel present. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Jabba the Hutt's clan requires all members to carry ritual scarring identifying them forever as heirs to the Nal Hutta legacy. These tattoos are considered marks of power.

front.title: •Desilijic Tattoo (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Bounty hunters and your [Independent Starship] starships are defense value +1 and forfeit +2. Once per turn, when a bounty hunter uses a non-[Permanent Weapon] weapon to hit a character, target is forfeit -2 and opponent places top card of Reserve Deck in Lost Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Jabba the Hutt's clan requires all members to carry ritual scarring identifying them forever as heirs to the Nal Hutta legacy. These tattoos are considered marks of power.

front.title: •Despair
front.gametext: If a Rebel was just captured or 'frozen,' deploy on another Rebel. That Rebel may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny (if Leia, she is also excluded from being the 'highest ability character'). If captive released, lose Immediate Effect.
front.lore: The carbonite froze more than just Han's body.

front.title: •Despair (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. During your battle phase, while you have a frozen captive, opponent's cards may not move. At same site as Jabba's Prize, opponent's cards are deploy +1 and your Force drains are +2. My Favorite Decoration may not be placed out of play. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The carbonite froze more than just Han's body.

front.title: •Despair (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. My Favorite Decoration may not be placed out of play. At same site as Jabba's Prize, opponent's characters deploy +1 and your Force drains are +1. While Jabba's Prize with Scum And Villainy, your total power in all battles is +3. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The carbonite froze more than just Han's body.

front.title: •Desperate Counter
front.gametext: Deploy on Death Star II system. When opponent moves from a related sector, for each TIE armed with a weapon there, movement destiny is -3 (limit -9). Also, you may deploy either Combat Response or Imperial Arrest Order from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Empire relied on the skill of its pilot corps to defend the Death Star reactor core from attack.

pulledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

front.title: •Desperate Counter (v)
front.gametext: Unless Imperial Propaganda on table, if you are about to lose Force during opponent's control phase, deploy on table to reduce loss by 4 (ignore other modifiers); opponent may immediately take any one card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. [Immune to Control]. OR Use 2 Force to deploy on table and stack one just-played interrupt here.
front.lore: The Empire relied on the skill of its pilot corps to defend the Death Star reactor core from attack.

front.title: •Destroyed Homestead
front.gametext: Deploy on Lars' Moisture Farm. Target Obi-Wan or Luke. Target may not apply ability toward drawing destiny for Sense, Alter or battle destiny. Opponent loses 1 Force during each of your control phases. Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target.
front.lore: 'Uncle Owen? Aunt Beru?'

front.title: Destroyer Droid
front.gametext: Permanent weapon is Twin Cannons (may target a character or vehicle using 1 Force; draw destiny; if destiny > defense value, target hit and opponent loses 1 Force). While with another destroyer droid, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: These Trade Federation droids are basically a mobile weapons platform. They were commissioned by the Trade Federation from the Colicoids of Colla IV.

combo: Destroyer Droid + Disarmed
Destroyer Droid + EV-9D9
Multiple Destroyer Droids + Abyssin Ornament
Destroyer Droid + Daultay Dofine

front.title: •Devastator
front.gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2.
front.lore: Supported the devastating subjugation of Ralltiir. While under the command of Darth Vader, chased and captured the traitor Princess Leia Organa aboard the consular ship Tantive IV.

combo: Devastator + Imperial Helmsman Draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

front.title: •Devastator (V)
front.gametext: May add 6 pilots and 4 TIEs.  Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. May follow an opponent's starship that just moved from same system (if within range). Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Supported the devastating subjugation of Ralltiir. While under the command of Darth Vader, chased and captured the traitor Princess Leia Organa aboard the consular ship Tantive IV.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Thomas Caspersen - Sandvika V-Lite 2005)

front.title: Dewback
front.gametext: Deploy only to a desert or Tatooine site. Ability = 1/4. May add 1 'rider' (passenger). When 'ridden' by a Sandtrooper, may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Protected by hard skin composed of tough armored scales. Frequently ridden by sandtroopers stationed in desert environments.

front.title: Dewback (V)
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Ability = 1/4. May add 1 'rider' (passenger). May be targeted by Trample instead of a piloted AT-AT. During battle, may 'roar' to make a character here defense value -1.
front.lore: Protected by hard skin composed of tough armored scales. Frequently ridden by sandtroopers stationed in desert environments.

front.title: •••DFS Squadron Starfighter
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo or same system as your battleship. While at same system as your battleship, may deploy Droid Starfighter Laser Cannons aboard from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Starfighters assigned to DFS Squadron are provided with advanced targeting routines to assist them in protecting Trade Federation command ships.

front.title: •DFS-1015
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to same location as your battleship. While with another droid starfighter at a system, once per battle if about to draw a battle destiny here, may instead draw two and choose one.
front.lore: Tactical support starfighter that utilizes learning subroutines to maximize the effectiveness of droid starfighter offensive strategies.

front.title: •DFS-1308
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to same location as your battleship. While with another droid starfighter at a system, opponent may not draw more than one battle destiny here.
front.lore: 1308 was one of several droids who aralyzed the N-1 starfighter during the Trade Federation's occupation of Naboo. Was unable to calculate the 'human factor' inside the N-1.

front.title: •DFS-327
front.gametext: While at same system as your battleship, DFS-327 is power +3, and opponent's pilots deploy +2 to starfighters at this system.
front.lore: Droid starfighter programmed for battleship defense. Will not pursue enemy starfighters once repelled, but can disable vital systems on attacking capital starships.

front.title: •Dianoga
front.gametext: * Ferocity = (power/ferocity of last character or creature eaten) + destiny. Habitat: exterior Dagobah sites, Trash Compactor and Dark Waters.
front.lore: 'Garbage squid' from Vodran's jungles. Changes color to match last meal. When unfed, turns transparent. Eats almost anything. Flexible eyestalk. 7 tentacles. Up to 6 meters long.

front.title: •Dianoga (V)
front.gametext: * Ferocity = 2 + destiny. Habitat: swamps, jungles, Trash Compactor, and Dark Waters. Whenever this creature eats an opponent's card, opponent loses 2 Force.
front.lore: 'Garbage squid' from Vodran's jungles. Changes color to match last meal. When unfed, turns transparent. Eats almost anything. Flexible eyestalk. 7 tentacles. Up to 6 meters long.

front.title: •Dioxis
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to target two opponent's Jedi at same interior battleground. Targets may not participate in battle for remainder of turn. OR Target opponent's Jedi. Draw destiny. If destiny > 2, target's game text is canceled for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Green gas that is lethal to most carbon-based life forms.

front.title: Direct Hit
front.gametext: Add X to one weapon destiny (before weapon destiny is drawn) when targeting a combat vehicle.USED: X = 1.  LOST: X = 3.
front.lore: Snowspeeders move much faster than AT-AT cannons can track, but if approaching on a poor attack vector, the snowspeeder is at the mercy of the well-trained AT-AT gunner.

front.title: •Director Orson Krennic
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. During your control phase, if with opponent's Undercover spy, opponent loses 2 Force (may not be reduced). While at a site, opponent may not cancel or modify your battle destiny draws here.
front.lore: Commander. Leader.

front.title: Disarmed
front.gametext: If both players have a character with a weapon present at same site, deploy on that opponent's character during any control phase. Character loses all weapons, is power -1 and may no longer carry weapons. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: C-3PO's arm was pulled off by attacking Tusken Raiders. 'I don't think I can make it. You go on, Master Luke...I'm done for.'

combo: Disarmed + Dr. Evazan
Disarmed + Imperial Barrier

front.title: Disruptor Pistol
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior (1 on your non-unique warrior). May target a character or creature using 2 Force (for free if on your non-unique warrior). Draw destiny. Target lost if destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Highly specialized weapon used for disintegration. Commonly found on the black market and in criminal arsenals. One of the favored weapons of the Black Sun.

front.title: •Djas Puhr
front.gametext: Power +1 for each [Dark Side Force] present, +2 under 'nighttime conditions.' Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Male Sakiyan, a race often employed as assassins. Bounty hunter. Incredible infrared peripheral vision. Has excellent aural and olfactory senses. Often tracks by scent.

combo: Djas Puhr + Res Luk Ra'auf

front.title: •Djas Puhr (V)
front.gametext: Power +3 under 'nighttime conditions'. Blaster Rifle deploys and fires for free on (and is a matching weapon for) Djas Puhr. Immune to attrition < 3 (< 5 while armed with a weapon).
front.lore: Male Sakiyan, a race often employed as assassins. Bounty hunter. Incredible infrared peripheral vision. Has excellent aural and olfactory senses. Often tracks by scent.

front.title: •Djas Puhr (V)
front.gametext: Power, defense value, and forfeit +1 for each [Dark Side Force] icon here. Your total ability may not be reduced at same site. Your Force drains here may not be canceled by [Reflections III] Leia.
front.lore: Male Sakiyan, a race often employed as assassins. Bounty hunter. Incredible infrared peripheral vision. Has excellent aural and olfactory senses. Often tracks by scent.

front.title: •Do They Have A Code Clearance?
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Unique ( •) Imperials of ability = 3 are forfeit +3. If opponent just retrieved Force using an Interrupt or Utinni Effect, you may place that card here. Opponent's Force retrieval is reduced by X, where X = number of cards here. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Imperial officers are always on the lookout for Rebel espionage.

front.title: •Do They Have A Code Clearance?
front.gametext: Plays on table. If opponent just retrieved Force using an Interrupt or Utinni Effect, you may place that card here. Opponent's Force retrieval is reduced by X, where X = number of cards here.
front.lore: Imperial officers are always on the lookout for Rebel espionage.

front.title: •Do They Have A Code Clearance? (Coruscant) (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. Outrider does not place Utinni Effects out of play. If opponent just retrieved Force using an Interrupt or Utinni Effect, you may stack that card here. Opponent's Force retrieval is reduced by X, where X = number of cards here
front.lore: Imperial officers are always on the lookout for Rebel espionage.

front.title: •Do They Have A Code Clearance? (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. Outrider does not place Utinni Effects out of play. If opponent just retrieved Force using an Interrupt or Utinni Effect, you may stack that card here. Opponent's Force retrieval is reduced by X, where X = number of cards here
front.lore: Imperial officers are always on the lookout for Rebel espionage.

front.title: •Dodo Bodonawieedo
front.gametext: Power +2 at Mos Eisley. Opponent's Jawas are power -1 here. Once during each of your control phases, may peek at top X cards of your Force Pile, reorder however you wish and replace, where X = number of other musicians at same site.
front.lore: Rodian musician. Plays slitherhorn. Grew up in the streets of Mos Eisley. 'Frocked' Jawas and stole ronto steaks as a child. Information broker. Was part of the Shawpee gang.

front.title: •Dominator
front.gametext: May add 4 pilots, 6 passengers, 1 vehicle and 2 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Laser Cannon Battery may deploy aboard (and may fire twice per battle).
front.lore: Victory-class hull overhauled with powerful thrusters and latest hyperdrive technology. Engineered to support task forces combating Rebel starfighters.

combo: Dominator + Imperial Helmsman Draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

front.title: •Dominator (V)
front.gametext: Destiny +2 when drawn for destiny. May add 2 pilots, 4 passengers, and 2 TIEs. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. May reveal this starship from hand to place on Used Pile.
front.lore: Victory-class hull overhauled with powerful thrusters and latest hyperdrive technology. Engineered to support task forces combating Rebel starfighters.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Dominic Gaudreault - Quebec Provincial 2005)

front.title: •Don't Move!
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated, and two of your troopers are armed with weapons, target one opponent's character present. Draw destiny: (0-2) no effect, (3-4) target is power = 0 for remainder of turn, (5+) target captured.
front.lore: Stormtroopers rely on an intimidating presence and technologically superiority.

front.title: •Dooku's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on Dooku or a [Separatist] character of ability > 4. Adds 1 to this character's duel and lightsaber combat totals. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Dooku's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on Dooku or a [Separatist] character of ability > 4. Adds 1 to this character's duel and lightsaber combat totals. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Blank.

pulledBy: I Will Finish What You Started

front.title: •Dooku's Solar Sailer
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 2 passengers. Dooku deploys free aboard. While Dooku aboard, immune to attrition and opponent must have at least two piloted starships to initiate battle at same system.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: Double Back
front.gametext: If a Bounty Hunter is lost, use 1 Force to retrieve one bounty hunter from your Lost Pile. OR Use 3 Force to search your Reserve Deck, take one bounty hunter into hand and reshuffle.
front.lore: Having lost sight of Boba Fett, Luke was surprised by his sudden reappearance.

front.title: Double Back (V)
front.gametext: USED: Take 4-LOM, non-[Maintenance] Boba Fett, Danz Borin, or Dengar into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: During your move phase, your bounty hunter (or [Independent] starship they are piloting) may make an additional move. OR Move your bounty hunter as a 'react'.
front.lore: Having lost sight of Boba Fett, Luke was surprised by his sudden reappearance.

front.title: •Double Laser Cannon
front.gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on Jabba's Sail Barge or your sandcrawler; it is power +3 and immune to attrition < 5. If your warrior aboard here, may target a vehicle using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +2 > defense value.
front.lore: Similar power output to the Atgar P-tower. Equipped with a hydrolic coolant system. Effective in dealing with raiding swoop gangs.

front.title: Double-Crossing, No-Good Swindler
front.gametext: If Han and your Lando are at same site, opponent loses 3 Force. OR If Nabrun Leids just completed a transport, Nabrun is lost and you may immediately deploy cards to that site from hand (at normal use of the Force, but troopers deploy free).
front.lore: 'You've got a lot of guts coming here. . . after what you pulled.'

front.title: •D'Qar
front.gametext: Dark:  Once per turn, if you just moved a [First Order] starship to here, may activate 2 Force.  Light:  Unless your Resistance leader here, Force drain -1 here.

front.title: •Dr. Chelli Lona Aphra
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything she pilots. Deploys free to an unoccupied site. Your droids are deploy -1 here. When deployed, may search your Lost Pile and move one card there ot the top of that pile (if that card is a droid, may retrieve it into hand).
front.lore: Female information broker, spy, and thief. Trade Federation.

front.title: •Dr. Evazan
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. The not-so-good doctor may 'operate' on any other character present that was just 'hit' or just Disarmed; 'patient' is lost.
front.lore: Thug. Smuggler. Twisted 'doctor'. Disfigured by blaster. Has death sentence in over 12 systems. Notorious partner of Ponda Baba. Aliases: Dr. Cornelius and Rooboo.

combo: Dr. Evazan + Disarmed + any character weapon
Dr. Evazan + Dannik Jerriko + any character weapon
Dr. Evazan + Ponda Baba

front.title: •Dr. Evazan & •Ponda Baba
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything they pilot. Power -3 if opponent has a lightsaber present. Draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. May target any other character present that was just 'hit.' Target character is lost.
front.lore: Smugglers who met each other in the Corellian system. Gained the rights to Han Solo's old smuggling routes from Jabba the Hutt. They don't like you either.

front.title: •Dr. Evazan's Sawed-off Blaster
front.gametext: Deploy on Dr. Evazan (may deploy on him as a 'react') or use 3 Force to deploy on your warrior. May target a character or creature at same or adjacent site using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value. May fire repeatedly.
front.lore: Equipped with powerful infrared scope. Extremely sensitive trigger mechanism. Used to earn Evazan the death sentence on several systems.

canceledBy: Game text canceled by Mandalorian Mishap

front.title: Dragonsnake
front.gametext: Ferocity = 3 + destiny. Habitat: swamps, jungles and Dark Waters. May attack droids. Defeated droids are relocated to an adjacent exterior site (opponent of victim chooses).
front.lore: One of Dagobah's deadliest predators. Has razor-sharp fins, powerful constrictor coils and large fangs. Feeds on almost anything. Often mistaken for a swamp slug, due to its size.

front.title: •Dreaded Imperial Starfleet
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Once per turn, you may cancel a Force drain by placing her from hand any non-unique starfighter. Starfighters may deploy from here as if from hand (if Effect canceled by opponent, any starfighters here may immediately deploy for free).
front.lore: The Empire uses short-range fighters and patrol craft to maintain a presence in every system within its scope of power.

combo: Dreaded Imperial Starfleet + Sienar Fleet Systems + Commander Brandei + TIE's with matching pilots.

front.title: •Dreaded Imperial Starfleet (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  While you have more systems on table than opponent, your capital starships may deploy at -2 (to a maximum of -3) to battlegrounds.  When you deploy an Imperial-Class Star Destroyer, may deploy (for free) a [Death Star II] or [A New Hope] squadron there (no replacement necessary) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Empire uses short-range fighters and patrol craft to maintain a presence in every system within its scope of power.

front.title: Dreadnaught-Class Heavy Cruiser
front.gametext: May add 3 pilots, 6 passengers and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 2. Turbolaser Battery may deploy aboard. Your TIEs present are each power +1.
front.lore: Introduced during the Clone Wars. 600 meters long. Some have cargo space converted to TIE hanger bays. Still used to maintain an Imperial presence in the Outer Rim.

combo: Dreadnaught-Class Heavy Cruiser + Kessel + 4 TIE Fighters
Dreadnaught-Class Heavy Cruiser + Darth Vader + Vader's Custom TIE + DS-61-2 + Black 2 + DS-61-3 + Black 3 + DS-61-4 + Black 4

front.title: Droid Detector
front.gametext: Deploy at any interior site. Cannot be moved. Droids may not deploy to same site. Following the turn this device is deployed, all droids present are lost at end of any turn.
front.lore: To keep out the mechanicals he so detested, Wuher installed an automatic droid detector at the entrance to the Mos Eisley Cantina.

front.title: •Droid Racks
front.gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on table. If your battle droid was just lost, may place it here. During your control phase, may use 2 Force (1 Force if your piloted MTT on table) to take any battle droid from here into hand. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Trade Federation utilizes such efficient methods of droid deployment that it is rumored even they do not know exactly how many battle droids are in circulation

front.title: •Droid Racks (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Invasion. Where Are Those Droidekas?! ignores Neimoidians. If your destroyer droid was just lost, may stack it here. During your control phase, may use 2 Force to place any destroyer droid here in Used Pile. If your vehicle or character (except a Neimoidian or destroyer droid) at a site, this Effect lost. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Trade Federation utilizes such efficient methods of droid deployment that it is rumored even they do not know exactly how many battle droids are in circulation

front.title: •Droid Racks (V)
front.gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on table. While present with a Jedi, destroyer droids are defense value +2. If your destroyer droid was just lost, may stack it here. During your control phase, may use 2 Force to play any destroyer droid here in Used Pile.(Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Trade Federation utilizes such efficient methods of droid deployment that it is rumored even they do not know exactly how many battle droids are in circulation

front.title: Droid Starfighter
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to same location as your battleship. Power -1 unless your droid control ship present. While another droid starfighter here, opponent's starfighters present are each power -1.
front.lore: These automated starfighters are managed by the Droid Control Ship and are used en masse by the Trade Federation to overwhelm an opponent with sheer numbers.

front.title: Droid Starfighter Laser Cannons
front.gametext: Deploy on your droid starfighter. May target a starship using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value. If destiny +1 = defense value, target is power = 0 until end of turn.
front.lore: Standard weapon aboard all droid starfighters. Used to eliminate fast- moving starfighters which battleship laser batteries have difficulty targeting.

front.title: Droid Walker
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to same site as your MTT.  AT-AT Cannon may deploy aboard, and targets it hits cannot be used to satisfy attrition. Unless alone, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Enclosed.

front.title: Droideka
front.gametext: Permanent weapon is Twinc Blaster Cannons (may target a character or vehicle; draw destiny; add 2 if targeting a vehicle; if total destiny > defense value, target hit and you may activate 1 Force). While with another [Presence] droid at a site, adds one battle destiny.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: Droideka
front.gametext: Permanent weapon is Twin Blaster Cannons (may target a character or vehicle; draw destiny; add 2 if targeting a vehicle; if total destiny > defense value, target hit and you may activate 1 Force). While with another [Presence] droid at a site, adds one battle destiny.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Drop Your Weapons
front.gametext: Target an opponent's weapon at same site as your battle droid. Each of that weapon's destiny draws are -1 for remainder of turn. OR If your battle droid just fired a blaster and hit a character, all opponent's weapons at same site are lost.
front.lore: In situations of confrontation, a command high on a battle droid's priority queue is to neutralize any kind of armament an opponent has.

front.title: •Drop!
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on table. During your move phase, if opponent has 13 or more cards in hand, you may use 4 Force to place all but 8 (random choice) in Used Pile. Once during any control phase, you may place up to three cards from hand in Used Pile.
front.lore: Anakin had to heed Qui-Gon's advice to avoid the rapidly approaching storm.

combo: Drop! + Monnok (Lost)
Drop! + Monnok (Lost) + Voyeur

front.title: •Drop! (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  [Permanent weapon] and [Maintenance] cards do not add battle destiny draws.  During battle, neither player may add more than two destiny to power (or total power) or one destiny to total attrition.  Once per turn, may place a card from hand in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Anakin had to heed Qui-Gon's advice to avoid the rapidly approaching storm.

front.title: •Drop! (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. While no card stacked here, may stack opponent's just-played Interrupt here. Opponent may use 3 Force to place an Interrupt here in Used Pile. Once per turn, may place a card from hand on bottom of Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Anakin had to heed Qui-Gon's advice to avoid the rapidly approaching storm.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Matthew Carulli)

front.title: •DS-181-3
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Saber 3, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Opponent may not 'react' to same system or sector.
front.lore: Flies Saber 3 in fighting 181st. Studied under Baron Fel at the Prefsbelt Imperial Academy; now flies as his wing. Nicknamed 'Fel's Wrath'. Watches the Baron's back.

front.title: •DS-181-4
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of any TIE he pilots. Once during each of your deploy phases, you may take one unique ( •) TIE Interceptor into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Wingman of Major Phennir. Earned promotion to Fel's squadron by scoring 12 kills at Mon Calamari. Repeatedly refused further promotion so that he could remain in the 181st.

front.title: •DS-61-11 In Black 11
front.gametext: Permanent pilot is •DS-61-11, who provides ability of 2. Whenever you deploy a TIE simultaneously with a pilot character, your Force retrieval from Sienar Fleet Systems is +1. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Stationed aboard command ship Executor. Pilot known as 'Wampa' for icy precision in battle. Often serves as escort to Lord Vader's shuttle.

front.title: •DS-61-2
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Black 2, also adds 1 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Vader's left wingman. Flies Black 2. Specially trained pilot held in reserve for mission with Vader. Nicknamed 'Mauler Mithel.'

front.title: •DS-61-3
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Black 3, also adds 1 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Vader's right wingman. Flies Black 3. Reputation for ferocity in combat. Corellian pilot with excellent skills. Nicknamed 'Backstabber.'

front.title: •DS-61-4
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Black 4, also may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. May use 1 Force to take one Lone Pilot into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Imperial pilot nicknamed 'Dark Curse.' Survived assaults against several dissenter worlds including Ralltiir and Mon Calamari. Intends to retire after his next combat mission.

front.title: •DS-61-5
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots, 3 when piloting Black 5.  While piloting Black 5, it is maneuver +1 and he draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.  If at opponent's system, instead of Force draining here, may take any card into hand from Force Pile; reshuffle.

front.title: •DS-61-5
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots, 3 when piloting Black 5.  While piloting Black 5, it is maneuver +1 and he draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.  If at opponent's system, instead of Force draining here, may take any card into hand from Force Pile; reshuffle.

front.title: DSD1 Dwarf Spider Droid
front.gametext: While with a [Clone Army] card or another Spider Droid, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Permanent weapon is Self-Destruct (may target a character present; draw destiny; if destiny +2 > defense value, target hit and forfeit -4, and this character also hit.)
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Dud Bolt's Podracer
front.gametext: Deploy on Podrace Arena. Adds 1 to each of your race destinies here. If Sebulba's Podracer on table, may lose this Podracer to cancel Losing Track or Neck And Neck; place all race destinies here in owner's Used Pile.
front.lore: RS 557 Podracer. Secretly hired by Sebulba to protect him during Podraces.

front.title: •Dune Sea Sabacc
front.gametext: Requirements: A Jawa at a Tatooine site. Wild cards (0-7): sandcrawler sites, Magnetic Suction Tube, Jawa Siesta and Jawa Pack. Clone cards: Tatooine locations, sandcrawlers, Jawa weapons, and Utinni! Stakes: One device or droid with out armor.
front.lore: Popular among Tatooine's native population. Apart from the Jawas, no one else seems to understand the rules.

combo: Dune Sea Sabacc (or any Sabacc really) + Trinto Duaba + Voyeur Play Sabacc to get cards in their Used Pile, then the other 2 Interrupts to make them lose Force/other cards. (maxbeedo)
Dune Sea Sabacc + Iasa, The Traitor Of Jawa Canyon

front.title: •••Dune Walker
front.gametext: Deploy -1 to a desert or Tatooine site. May add 1 pilot and 6 passengers. Immune to attrition < 4. Landspeed may not be increased. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1.
front.lore: Enclosed armored transport adapted for hot climates by replacing tertiary weapons systems with additional Sienar t23 heat dissipation units.

combo: Dune Walker + Trample

front.title: <>Dungeon (Prison)
front.gametext: Dark:  May not deploy to Bespin, Dagobah, or a Rebel Base. Whenever you imprison a captive (without a bounty) here, may retrieve 2 Force (once per captive).  Light:  If you control, instead of Force draining, may release one imprisoned captive here.

front.title: •Durge
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. Power +1 for each opponent's character present with ability > 3. While present on Muunilinst, adds one battle destiny. If Durge was just lost, may use 2 Force to 'regenerate' (take him into hand).
front.lore: Gen'Dai bounty hunter and assassin.

front.title: •Durge's NovaSword Fighter
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Durge deploys -1 aboard. Adds one destiny to power if your [Separatist] card aboard (or one battle destiny if Durge aboard). Immune to attrition < 4 (< 6 if Durge aboard).
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: E Chu Ta
front.gametext: One of your protocol droids 'insults' one character present, canceling that character's game text for remainder of turn. OR During your battle phase, initiate a battle where both players have droids (but no presence or spies). Both sides add one battle destiny.
front.lore: 'How rude!'

combo: E Chu Ta + U-3PO (Yoo-Threepio) or E-3PO

front.title: •E-3PO
front.gametext: Total power at same site is +1 for each of your alien/Imperial pairs present. Once during every turn, may use 1 Force to 'insult' one opponent's droid present (except R2-D2), canceling that droid's game text for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Brought to Cloud City by the Empire. Facilitates Imperial-to-alien cummunication. Relayed carbonite chamber modifiation instructions to Ugloste. Arrogant. Rude. Vulgar.

front.title: •E-3PO (V)
front.gametext: While with C-3PO, C-3PO's game text (and game text of cards on him) is canceled. E Chu Ta is destiny +3 when drawn for weapon or battle destiny. During any control phase, may take E Chu Ta into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Brought to Cloud City by the Empire. Facilitates Imperial-to-alien cummunication. Relayed carbonite chamber modifiation instructions to Ugloste. Arrogant. Rude. Vulgar.

front.title: E-web Blaster
front.gametext: Deploy on any site. May be moved with two warriors for 1 additional Force. Your warrior present may target a starfighter (use 5 as defense value), character, creature or vehicle using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.
front.lore: Massive infantry weapon powerful enough to damage even starfighters.

front.title: <>Early Warning Network
front.gametext: Deploy on an interior site that has a Scomp link. While you occupy this site, once per battle you may deploy a non-unique Imperial starship as a 'react' (for free if starfighter) to the related system from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to alter.)
front.lore: Listening posts are often constructed as part of a standard Imperial installation. On Endor, such a post was incorporated into the control bunker.

pulledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

front.title: •Edcel Bar Gane
front.gametext: Agenda: ambition. While in a senate majority, opponent may not draw more than one battle destiny in battles at battleground sites and you may not cancel opponent's battle destiny draws at sites.
front.lore: Senator from the planet Roona. One of the first to support Amidala's motion for a vote of no confidence in Supreme Chancellor Valorum. Intolerant of other species.

front.title: •Eee Chu Wawa!
front.gametext: USED: For remainder of turn, subtract 1 from forfeit of each opponent's Ewok (or subtract 2 from any one opponent's character).  LOST: Cancel one Ewok's game text for remainder of turn. OR Cancel Sound The Attack.
front.lore: Paploo's brave diversion provided more of a ride than the adventurous Ewok had bargained for.

front.title: EG-6 (Eegee-Six)
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of each of your droids present, except power droids. *Destiny equals zero, but if drawn as a battle destiny where you have less power than opponent, your total power present is doubled (once per battle).
front.lore: Ambulatory power generator made by Veril Line Systems to support equipment and vehicles. Slow-witted. This EG unit is memory-wiped and doesn't know its name or serial number.

front.title: Electro-Rangefinder
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any AT-AT Cannon. It may fire at targets two sites away. Also, when used to Target The Main Generator, adds 1 to total.
front.lore: Long-range stereoscopic sighting device connected to the cannons of an Imperial walker. Calibrated to allow the AT-AT commander to accurately fire at distant targets.

front.title: Elis Helrot
front.gametext: At any time (except during battle), target any or all of your characters at one site to 'transport' (relocate) to any one other site. Draw destiny. Use that much Force to 'transport,' or place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: A Givin pilot who can seal his joints to withstand the vacuum of space. Makes slaving and spike runs to Kala'uun. Has made many special modifications to his ship, the Hinthra.

canceledBy: Quite A Mercenary makes all characters transported by Elis Helrot lost

front.title: •Elis in Hinthra
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 3 passengers. Permanent pilot is •Elis, who provides ability of 2. Once per game, may deploy a smuggler aboard from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at opponent's system, adds one [Light Side]. Immune to attrition <5.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Elis in Hinthra
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 3 passengers. Permanent pilot is •Elis, who provides ability of 2. Once per game, may deploy a smuggler aboard from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at opponent's system, adds one [Light Side]. Immune to attrition <5.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •••Elite Squadron Stormtrooper
front.gametext: Power +2 while armed with a blaster. When using a blaster, subtracts 1 from Force required to fire it. Adds 2 to forfeit of each stormtrooper of ability < 2 at same site.
front.lore: Commander Igar selected the Empire's most dedicated stormtroopers to guard Endor for the Emperor. All they know is killing and white uniforms.

front.title: •••Elite Squadron Stormtrooper (V)
front.gametext: Clone. Heroic. Deploys -1 if a Dark Jedi at Senate. Power +2 if with Order 66. Jedi here are Heroic. Permanent weapon is blaster rifle (may target a character or vehicle for free; draw destiny; target hit if destiny > defense value).
front.lore: Commander Igar selected the Empire's most dedicated stormtroopers to guard Endor for the Emperor. All they know is killing and white uniforms.

front.title: Emergency Deployment
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle where opponent has more than double your power, reveal up to 3 cards from your Reserve Deck. Of those 3, deploy anywhere (for free) any characters, starships, vehicles, devices or weapons. Any others are lost.
front.lore: TIE fighters are stored in large racks far above the hangar deck. Catapulted into space by powerful tractor beam generators, TIEs can quickly scramble to engage the enemy.

front.title: Emergency Deployment (V)
front.gametext: Take a device or a non-lightsaber weapon into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If opponent just initiated a battle or Force drain at a system or sector, deploy (as a 'react') an unpiloted TIE and a pilot of ability < 3 (simultaneously) on table from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: TIE fighters are stored in large racks far above the hangar deck. Catapulted into space by powerful tractor beam generators, TIEs can quickly scramble to engage the enemy.

front.title: •Emperor Palpatine
front.gametext: Never deploys or moves (even aboard a starship or vehicle) to a site opponent occupies. Where present, subtracts 3 from attempts to cross Vader over. Once per turn, you may take Force Lightning into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Sith Master and leader of Galactic Empire. Dark side mentor to Darth Vader. Controls the Empire by instilling fear in its subjects and greed in its governors.

combo: Emperor Palpatine + Force Lightning
Emperor Palpatine + I Have You Now Add one battle destiny (two if Rebel is Luke) if a Dark Jedi and a Rebel with ability > 2 are involved in the same battle.
Emperor Palpatine + Force Field Cancels an attempt to target a Dark Jedi with a character weapon.
Emperor Palpatine + Janus Greejatus
Emperor Palpatine + Overseeing It Personally

front.title: •Emperor Palpatine, Foreseer
front.gametext: Never deploys or moves (even if carried) to a site opponent occupies. Once during your turn, may peek at the top three cards of your Reserve Deck; place one in Used Pile, one in Lost Pile, and take one into hand. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: From his throne room aboard the second Death Star, Emperor Palpatine monitors activity throughout the galaxy. Leader.

combo: Emperor Palpatine + Force Lightning
Emperor Palpatine + I Have You Now Add one battle destiny (two if Rebel is Luke) if a Dark Jedi and a Rebel with ability > 2 are involved in the same battle.
Emperor Palpatine + Force Field Cancels an attempt to target a Dark Jedi with a character weapon.
Emperor Palpatine + Janus Greejatus
Emperor Palpatine + Overseeing It Personally

front.title: •Emperor's Personal Shuttle
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability 2. Emperor deploys for free aboard. While Emperor aboard, immune to attrition and adds one battle destiny.
front.lore: Transport used extensively by Emperor Palpatine. Extremely well guarded. Pilots ordered to maintain constant contact with all nearby Imperial strike forces.

combo: Emperor's Personal Shuttle + Emperor Palpatine

front.title: •Emperor's Power
front.gametext: Deploy on your Throne Room. You may not Force drain here. While Emperor here, opponent's characters are deploy +2 to Death Star II sites and, one per turn, you may lose Effect (or 1 Force from top of Reserve Deck) to add one battle destiny anywhere. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: From his throne room aboard the second Death Star, Emperor Palpatine monitors activity throughout the galaxy.

pulledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

front.title: •Emperor's Power (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Emperor. Jedi are power -1 and deploy +1. During your control phase, if Emperor present at a battleground site with Vader (or two Imperial Council Members), opponent loses 1 Force.
front.lore: From his throne room aboard the second Death Star, Emperor Palpatine monitors activity throughout the galaxy.

front.title: •Empire's New Order
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Droid Merchant game text is canceled. Also, while none of your ability on table is provided by aliens, retrieve 1 Force after each battle in which opponent's alien is lost (or 2 if Ewok, Elom or operative). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Palpatine's cruel vision of his Empire included the enslavement and subjugation of entire species.

pulledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

front.title: •Empire's New Order (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Whenever an opponent's alien is just lost, they lose 1 Force. While all of your ability on table is provided by Imperials and Imperial starship pilots, your admirals, generals, moffs, and Emperor are deploy -1 and are forfeit +1. Aliens are deploy +1 and forfeit -1.
front.lore: Palpatine's cruel vision of his Empire included the enslavement and subjugation of entire species.

front.title: •End This Destructive Conflict
front.gametext: USED: During a battle at a site, instead of firing one character weapon, cause one opponent's character present to be power -4 until end of turn.  LOST: During a battle at a site, use 3 Force to cancel one battle destiny just drawn.
front.lore: 'Join me, and together we can rule the galaxy as father and son.'

front.title: •Endor
front.gametext: Dark:  If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Endor site.  Light:  If you have no Ewoks on Endor, Force drain -1 here. To move or deploy your starship to here requires +1 Force.

combo: Endor + Establish Secret Base
Endor + Endor Shield (V) Opponent generates no Force at Endor system unless Rebel Strike Team on table.
Endor + Presence Of The Force + Endor Shield (V) Three Force icons for you, none for the Light Side. Opportunity to drain for three.

front.title: •Endor Occupation
front.gametext: Cancel Tatooine Celebration, Cloud City Celebration or Coruscant Celebration. (Immune to Sense.) OR During your activate phase, activate 1 Force for each Endor battleground you occupy.
front.lore: Each planet controlled by the Empire drains potential resources from the Rebel Alliance.

cancels: All My Urchins & Cloud City Celebration

front.title: Endor Operations / Imperial Outpost
front.gametext: Endor Operations:Deploy Endor system, Bunker and Landing Platform.{While} this side up, once during each of your control phases, may take one Ominous Rumors or Establish Secret Base into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if Ominous Rumors and Establish Secret Base are both on table.{Place} out of play if an Endor location is 'blown away'.Imperial Outpost:{While} this side up, at each Endor site where you have a biker scout or a piloted AT-ST, your Force drains may not be modified or canceled by opponent, except by a 'react'. Opponent draws no more than one battle destiny in each battle. Your AT-STs are immune to attrition < 3. Once during each of your draw phases, you may retrieve one biker scout.{Flip} this card if Ominous Rumors and Establish Secret Base are not both on table.{Place} out of play if an Endor location is 'blown away.'

back.title: Endor Operations / Imperial Outpost
back.gametext: Endor Operations:Deploy Endor system, Bunker and Landing Platform.{While} this side up, once during each of your control phases, may take one Ominous Rumors or Establish Secret Base into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if Ominous Rumors and Establish Secret Base are both on table.{Place} out of play if an Endor location is 'blown away'.Imperial Outpost:{While} this side up, at each Endor site where you have a biker scout or a piloted AT-ST, your Force drains may not be modified or canceled by opponent, except by a 'react'. Opponent draws no more than one battle destiny in each battle. Your AT-STs are immune to attrition < 3. Once during each of your draw phases, you may retrieve one biker scout.{Flip} this card if Ominous Rumors and Establish Secret Base are not both on table.{Place} out of play if an Endor location is 'blown away.'

front.title: •Endor Shield
front.gametext: Deploy on Bunker. Imperials deploy -1 here while Death Star II system orbits Endor and you control Bunker. At Death Star II system and each Death Star site opponent may not deploy and must use +3 Force to move there.
front.lore: Planetary scale shield projected from surface of Endor moon. Protected second Death Star during construction. Only another superlaser could penetrate it while operational.

pulledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

front.title: •Endor Shield (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Unless Rebel Strike Team on table, cancel opponent's Force generation at Endor system.  Twice per game, may take an admiral (except Piett) or general into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Whenever opponent's Endor on table, raise your converted Endor system to the top (if possible). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Planetary scale shield projected from surface of Endor moon. Protected second Death Star during construction. Only another superlaser could penetrate it while operational.

front.title: •Endor Shield (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  While your [Endor] objective on table (and opponent's [Endor] objective not on table) opponent generates no Force at Endor system. Twice per game, may take an Imperial admiral into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Planetary scale shield projected from surface of Endor moon. Protected second Death Star during construction. Only another superlaser could penetrate it while operational.

pulledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points
combo: Endor Shield (V) + Endor + Presence Of The Force Three Force icons for you, none for the Light Side. Opportunity to drain for three.

front.title: •Endor: Ancient Forest
front.gametext: Dark:  Your aliens are deploy -1 here (or -2 if Yuzzum). If your Yuzzum present, Force drain +1 here.  Light:

front.title: •Endor: Back Door
front.gametext: Dark:  During your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).  Light:  If you control, during your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).

combo: Endor: Back Door + Closed Door

front.title: •Endor: Bunker
front.gametext: Dark:  Once per game, you may deploy Endor Shield from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Light:  You may move here only from Back Door. While you control, Endor Shield is suspended.

combo: Endor: Bunker + Major Hewex

front.title: •Endor: Dark Forest
front.gametext: Dark:  Your Yuzzum are each power +1 here. If your Imperial is present, Force drain +1 here.  Light:  Your Ewoks are each deploy +1 here. If your Ewok present, Force drain +1 here.

front.title: •Endor: Dense Forest
front.gametext: Dark:  No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.  Light:  No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.

front.title: •Endor: Ewok Village
front.gametext: Dark:  No starships or vehicles here. If no Ewoks on Endor, Force drain +1 here.  Light:  No starships or vehicles here. If your Ewok present, Force drain +1 here.

front.title: •Endor: Forest Clearing
front.gametext: Dark:  Your vehicles are each power +1 here. Force drain +1 here.  Light:  Your vehicles are each power +1 here.

front.title: •••Endor: Great Forest
front.gametext: Dark:  Your character movement from here (except for Yuzzum and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.  Light:  Your character movement from here (except for Ewok and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.

front.title: •Endor: Landing Platform (Docking Bay)
front.gametext: Dark:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force (free if your Imperial present).  Light:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 7 Force. Your transit to here requires +9 Force.

front.title: Energy Shell Launchers
front.gametext: Deploy on your AAT. May target a character or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. May subtract 1. If destiny = target's destiny number, target is hit.
front.lore: AAT weapon designed for wide-spread destruction. Can devastate opposing infantry.

front.title: •Energy Walls
front.gametext: During your control phase, deploy on Theed Palace Generator Core. No more than one character may deploy to here each turn, and characters may not move to or from here. Immediate Effect lost at end of opponent's turn.
front.lore: Theed security protocol proved to be a deciding variable in the duel of the fates.

front.title: Enhanced TIE Laser Cannon
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your TIE. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Subtract 2 if targeting a capital starship. Target hit if destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Sienar Fleet Systems' latest laser cannon prototype increases the firepower most Imperial TIEs - but many Moffs consider the weapon too expensive for widespread use.

front.title: •••Enter The Bureaucrat
front.gametext: If you just lost more than 2 Force to a Force drain, deploy on opponent's location. You lose no more than 1 Force from Force drains here. At any time, you may place Immediate Effect in Used Pile to draw two cards from top of Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Even the most effective of operations can be easily mired under the Republic's plethora of procedural red tape.

front.title: •Ephant Mon
front.gametext: Opponent's spies, gamblers and thieves may not deploy or move to same site. When with Jabba in a battle, power +2 and, if forfeited, may satisfy all remaining battle damage and attrition against you.
front.lore: Chevin smuggler. One of Jabba's few truly loyal associates. Keeps Jabba informed as to the various plots against his life. Leader.

combo: Ephant Mon + Jabba The Hutt (V) Ephant Mon works perfect with Jabba The Hutt (V), who needs a leader to protect him from targeting of weapons.
Ephant Mon + any Jabba

front.title: •Epic Duel
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. The Circle Is Now Complete or Vader's Obsession may be played to initiate an epic duel as follows: If Vader is present with specified target, each player draws two destiny (add 1 to each destiny draw if using a lightsaber). Add character's ability. If Vader loses, place him out of play. You lose 6 Force (9 if dueling Luke). If Obi-Wan loses, place him out of play. Opponent loses 9 Force. If Luke loses, opponent must choose: Cross Luke to the Dark Side and lose X Force, Where X = Luke's ability. OR Lose Luke and lose triple X Force.

front.title: •Epic Duel (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. A Jedi's Resilience may not be played during move phases. The Circle Is Now Complete or Vader's Obsession may be played during any move phase to initiate an epic duel as follows: If Vader present with specified target, each player draws two destiny (if armed with a lightsaber, each destiny is +1); add ability. Loser (lowest total) is lost, losing player loses 2 Force, and winning player may retrieve 2 Force.

front.title: •Eriadu
front.gametext: Dark:  Tarkin deploys free here. If you control, all Imperials with ability > 2 on table are forfeit +2.  Light:  If you control, Force drain +1 here.

front.title: Eriadu Operative
front.gametext: While at a Eriadu site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is power +1 (or +2 if your commander, general or moff is on Eriadu) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Eriadu from Reserve Deck- reshuffle.
front.lore: Used by Imperial officers as a contact between the Empire and local citizenry. Keep the Imperial bureaucracy informed on planetary issues.

front.title: Establish Control
front.gametext: Deploy on a docking bay you control. No Force drains here. Fallen Portal may not target a character at this site. Your Force drains are +2 at adjacent non-docking bay battleground sites. Place Effect in Used Pile if opponent controls this location.
front.lore: Keeping supply routes clear allows rapid distribution of resources to where they are most required.

combo: Establish Control + Begin Landing Your Troops

Establish Control + Tatooine: Mos Eisley + Tatooine: Docking Bay 94 + Tatooine: Cantina Control these three sites for a total Force drain of 8 each turn., not including any bonuses from lightsabers or other cards. For added protection, use His Name Is Anakin to make it more difficult for your opponent to deploy aliens to Tatooine.
cancels: Force drain at a docking bay you control
Fallen Portal targeting a character at that site

front.title: Establish Control (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Your Force generation is +1 at docking bays you occupy.  Your docking bays controlled by opponent are battlegrounds.  Once per game, may deploy Corulag or Fondor from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  If Mobilization Points on table, this Effect lost. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Keeping supply routes clear allows rapid distribution of resources to where they are most required.

front.title: Establish Control (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your Force generation is +1 at docking bays you occupy. Your docking bays controlled by opponent are battlegrounds. Once per game, may deploy Corulag or Fondor from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If Mobilization Points on table, this Effect lost. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Keeping supply routes clear allows rapid distribution of resources to where they are most required.

canceledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

front.title: •Establish Secret Base
front.gametext: Deploy on Endor system if your biker scouts and/or AT-STs control three Endor sites. Your Force drain here is +1 for each Endor site your biker scout or AT-ST controls (limit +3). Place Effect in Used Pile if opponent controls this system. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Empire's remote bases develop new technology and hide sensitive projects from potential Rebel saboteurs.

pulledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

front.title: •Establish Secret Base (V)
front.gametext: If you control Bunker, deploy on Endor system. At each Endor site you control with an AT-ST or Biker Scout, opponent's Force generation is canceled. During your deploy phase, may deploy one Aratech Corporation or an Effect with 'Endor' in the lore or game text from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Empire's remote bases develop new technology and hide sensitive projects from potential Rebel saboteurs.

front.title: •Establish Secret Base (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Bunker if you control that site. Your Force generation at Endor system may not be canceled. Once per turn, may deploy an Endor site from your reserve deck; reshuffle. Place Effect in Used Pile if opponent controls this site. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Empire's remote bases develop new technology and hide sensitive projects from potential Rebel saboteurs.

pulledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

front.title: •EV-9D9
front.gametext: During your control phase, may search Reserve Deck, take one power droid or Torture into hand and reshuffle. May Force drain at Droid Workshop, Droid Junkheap or Incinerator (+1 for each other droid present, including captive droids).
front.lore: MerenData EV supervisor droid. Particularly enjoys torturing power droids. A clumsy designer nearly broke this unit before it was shipped. She formerly worked at Cloud City.

front.title: Evacuate?
front.gametext: Unless Tarkin is aboard, save all characters, weapons and devices aboard any just-lost capital starship. Relocate them to any one planet site or one of your capital starships.
front.lore: Escape pods are on many starships allowing those in peril to flee, an act considered cowardly by Imperial officers. 'We've analyzed their attack, sir, and there is a danger.'

front.title: Evacuate? (V)
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to traget your character of ability > 3 alone at a site.USED: During any move phase, take target into hand.  LOST: If opponent has exactly one non-spy character at target's site, place target in Used Pile.
front.lore: Escape pods are on many starships allowing those in peril to flee, an act considered cowardly by Imperial officers. 'We've analyzed their attack, sir, and there is a danger.'

front.title: Evader
front.gametext: USED: Cancel all Revolutions in play (owner loses 1 Force for each).  LOST: If Vader or Vader's Custom TIE was just lost, relocate that card to Used Pile. OR Relocate to Used Pile one Imperial just lost from any Death Star location.
front.lore: A panic move by Black 2 send Vader spinning wildly from the Death Star trench-ironically sparing his life. His destiny would be fulfilled another time.

front.title: Evader & Monnok
front.gametext: USED: Cancel all Revolutions in play. OR If opponent has 13 or more cards in hand, place all but 8 (random selection) in Used Pile.  LOST: Use 4 Force to reveal opponent's hand. All cards opponent has two or more of in hand are lost.

front.title: •Everything Is Going As Planned
front.gametext: USED: If you just drew a [Separatist] card for destiny, take it into hand (may cancel and redraw it).  STARTING: If Separatist Uprising on table, deploy Droid Racks and two Effects that deploy for free, are always [Immune to Alter], and deploy on table. Place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: <>Execution Arena (Pit)
front.gametext: Dark:  May not deploy to Bespin, Dagobah, Endor or Hoth.  May deploy Dark Waters here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
