front.lore: Leader of Navy detachment assigned to guard the Endor control bunker. Liaison between Imperial technicians and command staff.

front.title: •Major Marquand
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of any combat vehicle he pilots. When piloting a combat vehicle with Watts, may add one battle destiny and, if that vehicle has immunity to attrition, adds 2 to immunity.
front.lore: Directed a counterattack against the Ewoks on Endor. Formerly crewed an AT-AT assigned to Devastator. Originally from Kessel.

combo: Major Marquand + combat vehicle + Lieutenant Watts

front.title: •Major Mianda
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of any TIE he pilots. Adds 2 to total weapon destiny of any TIE/ln he pilots.
front.lore: Commander of a TIE squadron assigned to defend the second Death Star during construction. Hand picked pilots to serve with him.

front.title: •Major Rhymer
front.gametext: Deploys -2 aboard Scimitar 1. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting a bomber making a Bombing Run, prevents opponent's characters at same site from using landspeed.
front.lore: Leader of Scimitar Squadron, the elite bomber wing assigned to defend the Endor shield generator from any ground assault.

front.title: •Major Turr Phennir
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of any TIE he pilots. When piloting Saber 2, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Once per game, you may take Fighters Coming In into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Executive officer of the 181st Imperial Fighter Wing. Older brother killed by Wedge Antillies at the Battle of Yavin.

front.title: Makurth
front.gametext: When in a battle at a site, may use 2 Force (or 1 Force if you initiated the battle) to 'scream' (add one destiny to your total power only). Immune to attrition < 4 under 'nighttime conditions.'
front.lore: A fierce race of nocturnal carnivores from Moltok. Charge into battle with a terrifying scream. Often find employment as bodyguards for Black Sun.

front.title: •Malakili
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. During your control phase, may snare (steal) one creature or unoccupied creature vehicle present. Creatures at same site (except Sarlacc) do not attack and cannot be attacked.
front.lore: Corellian. Worked for Circus Horrificus. Disapproves of Jabba's treatment of the rancor. Plotting with Lady Valarian to steal the immense beast away from Jabba's palace.

front.title: •Malakili (V)
front.gametext: Deploys -4 on Tatooine. Rancors may deploy here (even if Malakili is not the only character, habitat permitting), are defense value +4 here, and may not attack Malakili. During your deploy phase, may deploy one Rancor here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Corellian. Worked for Circus Horrificus. Disapproves of Jabba's treatment of the rancor. Plotting with Lady Valarian to steal the immense beast away from Jabba's palace.

front.title: •Malastare
front.gametext: Dark:  If you control, during your control phase may deploy Watto's Box (regardless of your current race total).  Light:  If you control, may use 4 Force to cancel Watto's Box.

front.title: •Mandalorian Armor
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on any Imperial or alien (except Vader or Boba Fett). Character is power +2, has armor = 5 and is immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Contains wrist lasers, rocket dart launchers, a flame projector, a projectable grappling hook, a concussion grenade launcher, four kinds of sensors and a broad band antenna.

front.title: •Mandalorian Armor (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on your alien of ability < 4. Character gains bounty hunter skill and Immunity to attrition < 4. If character just hit, may place this device in Lost Pile (Used Pile if on Jango) to restore it to normal.
front.lore: Contains wrist lasers, rocket dart launchers, a flame projector, a projectable grappling hook, a concussion grenade launcher, four kinds of sensors and a broad band antenna.

front.title: •Maneuver Check
front.gametext: Deploy on Death Star:Trench. Opponent must make maneuver check for starfighters leaving the trench. For each starfighter, owner draws destiny. If destiny + maneuver < 5, starfighter is lost.
front.lore: 'Luke, at that speed will you be able to pull out in time?'

front.title: •Maneuver Check (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per game, if Alderaan 'blown away,' may target a system; unless opponent has a capital (or [Episode I]) starship there, Objectives treat that system as a Subjugated planet. Starships may not move the turn they are deployed (or carried) to Death Star. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Luke, at that speed will you be able to pull out in time?'

front.title: •Mara Jade In VT-49 Decimator
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 2 passengers. Permanent pilot is •Mara Jade, who provides ability of 5. While alone and piloted by an Imperial, adds one battle destiny. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Mara Jade With Lightsaber
front.gametext: While Luke or Emperor on table, power +1 and she moves for free. Permanent weapon is •Mara Jade's Lightsaber (may target a character or creature for free; draw two destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).
front.lore: Ordered to kill Luke Skywalker. Assumed the identity of a dancer named 'Arica' in order to sneak into Jabba's Palace.

front.title: •Mara Jade With Lightsaber
front.gametext: While Luke or Emperor on table, power +1 and she moves for free. Permanent weapon is •Mara Jade's Lightsaber (may target a character or creature for free; draw two destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).
front.lore: Ordered to kill Luke Skywalker. Assumed the identity of a dancer named 'Arica' in order to sneak into Jabba's Palace.

front.title: •Mara Jade, The Emperor's Hand
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. Power +2 if Emperor on table. May be targeted by Vader's Obsession and Epic Duel instead of Vader. Once per game, may deploy a weapon on her from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Spy. Ordered to kill Luke Skywalker. Assumed the identity of a dancer named 'Arica' in order to sneak into Jabba's Palace.

pulls: A weapon to deploy on her
combo: Mara Jade, The Emperor's Hand + Nevar Yalnal

front.title: •Mara Jade's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on Mara Jade. May add 1 to Force Drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: As part of her training to become the Emperor's hand, Mara Jade learned from Palpatine himself how to effectively fight with a lightsaber.

pulledBy: I Will Finish What You Started

front.title: •Mara Jade's Lightsaber (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Mara Jade. May add 1 to Force drain where present. During battle, Mara may use a blaster and this weapon. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: As part of her training to become the Emperor's hand, Mara Jade learned from Palpatine himself how to effectively fight with a lightsaber.

front.title: •Marquand In Blizzard 6
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot is •Marquand, who provides ability of 2. Cards it hits are power and forfeit -2 and may not apply ability towards drawing battle destiny. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Enclosed.

front.title: •Marquand In Blizzard 6
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot is •Marquand, who provides ability of 2. Cards Blizzard 6 hits are power and forfeit -2 and may not apply ability towards drawing battle destiny. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Enclosed. Death Squadron.

front.title: Massassi Warrior
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to same site as a Dark Jedi. While with another Sith, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise and opponent's characters here are power -1. When lost from the same site as a Jedi, opponent loses 1 Force.

front.title: •Master, Destroyers!
front.gametext: USED: Target a character at same site as two of your destroyer droids. For remainder or turn, target may not fire weapons and is power -2.  LOST: Lose 1 Force to take up to three non-unique destroyer droids into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Shields protect destroyer droids from incoming or deflected blaster fire. Starfighter cannons, on the other hand, can cause some problems.

front.title: •Masterful Move
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to take one hologram, dejarik or Imperial holotable into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Cancel Mantellian Savrip. OR Cancel opponent's Force drain at a holosite.
front.lore: A skillful hologramer nullifies the advantage of even the most powerful game piece with clever maneuvering.

cancels: Opponent's Force drain at a holosite

front.title: •Masterful Move & •Endor Occupation
front.gametext: Cancel Tatooine Celebration, Cloud City Celebration, or Coruscant Celebration. (Immune to Sense.) OR Use 1 Force to take one hologram, dejarik, or Imperial Holotable into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Cancel Mantellian Savrip. OR Cancel opponent's Force drain at a holosite.

cancels: All My Urchins & Cloud City Celebration
Opponent's force drain at a holosite

front.title: Maul Strikes
front.gametext: If Maul in battle with a Jedi, add one battle destiny (two if Jedi is Qui- Gon). OR Use 1 Force to take any lightsaber into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Target a Jedi present with Maul; they duel: Both players draw 2 destiny. Loser (lowest total) is lost.
front.lore: A Sith needs no introduction.

front.title: Maul's Cape
front.gametext: Deploy on your character of ability > 3. Character gains scout skill, their weapon destiny draws are +1, and character is immune to Clash Of Sabers and attrition < 5.
front.lore: A Sith Lord can use the Force to reach out and find what he seeks.

front.title: •Maul's Double-Bladed Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on Maul. Adds 1 to Maul's lightsaber combat total. May lose 1 Force to add 2 to Force drain where present. Twice per battle, may target a character. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total > defense value. While on Maul, may not be stolen.
front.lore: Maul's double-bladed lightsaber is two lightsabers fused into one that requires years of training wield properly. Like its mysterious owner, this weapon hasn't been seen for a millennia.

pulledBy: I Will Finish What You Started

front.title: •Maul's Electrobinoculars
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on Maul. At any time you may use 1 Force to peek at the top card of your Force Pile. You may move that card to the top of your Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Advanced optics used by Darth Maul to help track Queen Amidala. Image enhancement features allow for better sensor readings.

combo: Maul's Electrobinoculars + any card that initiates a duel Guarantee yourself a solid start on any duel you initiate. A great deal, considering winning a duel is a rather large step toward victory in any game!

front.title: •Maul's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on Maul. While on Maul, may not be stolen. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Trained in the Sith arts, Maul's ferocity in combat is matched by no other. When armed with a lightsaber, his opponent's only option is usually that of escape.

pulledBy: I Will Finish What You Started

front.title: •Maul's Sith Infiltrator
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots. Maul deploys -3 aboard. While Maul piloting, immune to attrition and during your move phase, may lose 2 Force to 'cloak' (does not participate in battles) until end of next turn.
front.lore: One of Sienar Advanced Projects Laboratories' prototype designs. Equipped with advanced weaponry and a full-effect stygium-based cloaking device for invisibility on command.

pulledBy: Short Range Fighters & Watch Your Back!
combo: Maul's Sith Infiltrator + Darth Maul on Tatooine system Deploy for 6 (!)

front.title: •Maul's Sith Infiltrator (AI)
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots. Maul deploys -3 aboard. While Maul piloting, immune to attrition and during your move phase, may lose 2 Force to 'cloak' (does not participate in battles) until end of next turn.
front.lore: One of Sienar Advanced Projects Laboratories' prototype designs. Equipped with advanced weaponry and a full-effect stygium-based cloaking device for invisibility on command.

front.title: •Maul's Sith Speeder
front.gametext: May add Maul as driver. May deploy with Maul as a 'react'. During battle, Maul may disembark (place this vehicle in Used Pile) to cancel the immunity to attrition of a Jedi here. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Attain speeds of up to 600 kph. 3 meters long. Extremely difficult to control at high speeds. Dengar rode a similar swoop when injured in a race with Han at Agrilat.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Ryan French - Seattle V-Lite 2005)

front.title: Mercenary Pilot
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots or drives. When driving a transport vehicle, adds one battle destiny. When piloting at a cloud sector, once per turn adds one battle destiny during battle at a related exterior site.
front.lore: Smugglers. Candidates who resent authority often abandon Imperial academies to sell their piloting skills to criminals. Will work for any high paying crime syndicate.

front.title: Mercenary Pilot (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Adds 2 to the power of anything he drives. When driving a transport vehicle, adds one battle destiny. Once per turn, while piloting at a cloud sector, adds one battle destiny during battle at a related exterior site. [Reflection 3] Another Pathetic Lifeform ignores your non-unique aliens.
front.lore: Smugglers. Candidates who resent authority often abandon Imperial academies to sell their piloting skills to criminals. Will work for any high paying crime syndicate.

front.title: Mercenary Shadow Pirate
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots.  Opponent may not add destiny draws to power or attrition here.  Ice Storm and Sandwhirl are canceled at same and related locations.
front.lore: ISB. Female.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Peter Nordstrom - Northern CA Local 2009)

front.title: •Mercenary Slavers
front.gametext: Unless your [Reflections 2] objective on table, deploy on a site. Your smugglers and gangsters are slavers. Slavers are forfeit +2 and weapon destinies targeting them (or starships they pilot) are -1. 'Trandoshan' on your sites may be treated as 'slaver.' (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Hunters who track down escaped Wookiee slaves and report on their location. The Empire and Trandoshans pay a high price for that kind of information.

front.title: •Meson Martinet
front.gametext: May add 2 pilot and 3 passengers. Your total battle destiny here is +1 for each pirate aboard. While Quiggold or Sidon piloting, immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Blank.

pulledBy: Short Range Fighters & Watch Your Back!

front.title: •Meteor Impact?
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on an exterior planet site. Target a character on same planet. Character may not leave planet or move away from Utinni Effect. Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target.
front.lore: 'There's a meteorite that hit the ground near here. I wanna check it out. Won't take long.'

front.title: •Mighty Jabba
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to a Jabba's Palace site. When with your alien leader, adds one battle destiny. May escort a captive. To use his landspeed requires +1 Force. May not be targeted by weapons unless your other aliens present are each 'hit'. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Hutt leader of notorious criminal organization. Gangster of the vilest ilk. Would rather forfeit a fortune in cash than risk one whisper attesting to his mercy.

combo: Mighty Jabba + 4-LOM With Concussion Rifle 4-LOM adds one battle destiny with Jabba.
Mighty Jabba + Boelo Cancel one opponent's battle destiny.
Mighty Jabba + Ephant Mon + Chokk

front.title: •M'iiyoom Onith
front.gametext: Once during each of your control phases, may reveal opponent's hand by using X Force, where X = number of cards in opponent's hand. All unique (•) male Rebels and unique (•) male aliens there are lost.
front.lore: Female H'nemthe, a species whose females ritually kill their mates. Stranded on Tatooine due to questionable passage tax. Razor-sharp tongue. M'iiyoom means, 'nightlilly'.

canceledBy: Game text canceled by Another Pathetic Lifeform (V) - Defensive Shield

front.title: •Mind Tricks Don't Work On Me
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on table. During the damage segment of a battle your opponent initiated, if you have no cards left that can be forfeited, you may place this Effect out of play to cancel all remaining battle damage. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Watto is smart enough to not let himself get swindled by a Jedi bully.

front.title: •Mist Hunter
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots (one must be a smuggler or bounty hunter) and 3 passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Zuckuss is piloting. Has ship-docking capability.
front.lore: Commissioned by a group of Gand venture capitalists headed by Zuckuss. Manufactured by Byblos Drive Yards. Uses repulsor lift technology developed for combat cloud cars.

pulledBy: Short Range Fighters & Watch Your Back!

front.title: •Mist Hunter (V)
front.gametext: May add 2 alien pilots and 3 passengers. Zuckuss deploys free aboard. While Zuckuss piloting, opponent's weapon, battle, and asteroid destiny draws here are -2. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Commissioned by a group of Gand venture capitalists headed by Zuckuss. Manufactured by Byblos Drive Yards. Uses repulsor lift technology developed for combat cloud cars.

front.title: •Mitth'raw'nuruodo
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Once per turn, may target a related location; opponent loses 1 Force the next time they move to that location this turn. May lose 1 Force to cancel a just-drawn weapon destiny targeting a starship he is piloting. Thrawn's game text may not be canceled.
front.lore: Thrawn. Chiss commander. Leader.

front.title: •Mobilization Points
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your Force generation is +1 at each docking bay you occupy (or +2 if you control). Once per game, you may take one Carida, Wakeelmui, Gall, Kuat or Rendili system or Executor into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The imperial noose relies on swift troop dispatch from docking bays.

pulledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

front.title: Mobquet A-1 Deluxe Floater
front.gametext: May add 1 driver and 1 passenger. Moves free if Jabba or any bounty hunter aboard. May move for free as a 'react' to a battle where your thief, smuggler or bounty hunter is participating.
front.lore: Enclosed landspeeder often used by nefarious characters due to its luxury and evasive capabilities. Features include automated steering and fine Corellian leather.

front.title: •Moff Jerjerrod
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of any capital starship he pilots. Once during each of your turns, you may take one Death Star II sector or Superlaser Mark II into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Prevents opponent's spies from deploying to same Death Star II site.
front.lore: Leader. Found discussions with Vader to be particularly motivating. Does not want to find out if the Emperor is more forgiving than Vader.

front.title: •Moff Tarkin, Death Star Commandant
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots.  Deploys -2 to Death Star.  Your Force generation at Eriadu is +2.  Superlaser fires at starships for free, and targets it hits are forfeit -4.  Wherever you have an Imperial, you may initiate battles for free.  Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Leader.

front.title: •Molator
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. For each unit of ability you have present during a battle, you may use 1 Force to raise your total power by 1. Ability used in this way cannot also be used to draw destiny.
front.lore: Creature in dejarik hologame drawn from Alderaanian mythology. Stories describe molators as powerful, enchanted protectors of Alderaanian kings and queens.

front.title: •Molator (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If your character in battle is about to be lost before the damage segment, it is instead lost at end of battle (if forfeited, forfeit for 0). Characters of ability < 5 are immune to Goo Nee Tay. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Creature in dejarik hologame drawn from Alderaanian mythology. Stories describe molators as powerful, enchanted protectors of Alderaanian kings and queens.

front.title: •Moment Of Triumph
front.gametext: If Tarkin is defending a battle alone, add two battle destiny. OR If any alien is defending a battle alone, add one battle destiny.
front.lore: A ruthless ruler of Outer Rim Territories. Grand Moff Tarkin used the Death Star to destroy Alderaan, creating the doctrine of rule by fear.

front.title: •Mon Calamari
front.gametext: Dark:  If you occupy with a Star Destroyer, opponent's Star Cruisers are deploy +2 (and may not deploy here).  Light:  Force Drain -1 here. If you occupy with a Star Cruiser, opponent's Star Destroyers deploy +2 here.

front.title: Monnok
front.gametext: USED: If opponent has 13 or more cards in hand, place all but 8 (random selection) in Used Pile.  LOST: Use 4 Force to reveal opponent's hand. All cards opponent has two or more of in hand are lost.
front.lore: Dejarik creature. Savage predator from remote deserts of Soccorro. Respected and honored by Soccorran hunters, considered 'good luck' by superstitious smugglers.

combo: Monnok + Trinto Duaba
Monnok + Scanning Crew

front.title: •Moruth Doole, Kessel Administrator
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Kessel. While at a Kessel battleground site, your Force drains are +1 at X related locations, where X = number of 'spice' cards on Spice Mine Operations, and once per turn, may use 3 Force to take a 'spice' card you own into hand.

front.title: Mos Eisley Blaster
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your alien warrior (free if on Tatooine). May target a character for free. Draw destiny. Target is forfeit -2 for remainder of turn if destiny +2 > defense value.
front.lore: BlasTech DL-18. Carried by Jabba's guards. Typically used for covering fire, to protect a comrade or pin an enemy down. Nicknamed 'Mos Eisley Special.'

front.title: •Mosep
front.gametext: When opponent is losing Force from Force drains at the same or an adjacent site, lost Force must come from Reserve Deck if possible.
front.lore: Jabba's Nimbanel accountant. Inside contacts allow him to disrupt the cash flow of the Hutt's enemies. He knows a mistake could make him the next write-off.

combo: Mosep + Gailid

front.title: •Mostly Armless
front.gametext: If your character with a lightsaber just won a battle, deploy on an opponent's character present. Character is Disarmed (power -1 and may no longer carry weapons). Opponent loses 1 Force at the end of each opponent's turns. (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: One lesson learned in Jedi training is that when you have been injured, don't panic.

front.title: •Motion Supported
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If no senator here, you may place a senator here from hand to add 2 to your next Force drain at a battleground this turn. If a wealth agenda here, once per turn, you may lose your just drawn battle destiny to substitute it with a card from hand.
front.lore: 'The delegates from Malastare concur the with delegates from the Trade Federation. A commission must be appointed!'

combo: Motion Supported + Orn Free Taa + Galactic Senate + Orn Free Taa Every battle destiny is a high battle destiny.

front.title: •Motti
front.lore: Considered an overrated leader by many subordinates. Has a disturbing lack of faith. Became a member of the Death Star's command triumvirate despite his failings.

combo: Motti + Lone Pilot

front.title: •Mournful Roar
front.gametext: Deploy on Chewie if Han was just lost or just became missing. Opponent cannot play Let The Wookiee Win or Wookiee Roar. Opponent must also lose 1 Force at end of every player's turn. If Han on table, Effect canceled.
front.lore: With the thought of losing Han, Chewbacca let out an anguished, sorrowful, lamenting, mournful, angst-ridden, tormented, agonizing roar.

front.title: MSE-6 'Mouse' Droid
front.gametext: Landspeed = 3. Deploys to same site as a character targeted by a Utinni Effect (except Kessel Run). If this droid 'reaches' Utinni Effect, may relocate it here. Upon delivery, 'mouse' droid returns to your hand.
front.lore: Nicknamed for rodent-like appearance. Delivers orders and sensitive documents. Retractable manipulator arms. Made by Rebaxan Columni. Easily frightened.

front.title: •Much Anger In Him
front.gametext: Deploy on a Rebel. At the end of each opponent's battle phases, if you have presence at the location where that Rebel has presences and a battle did not take place there, opponent loses 4 Force.
front.lore: 'Adventure, heh. Excitement, heh. A Jedi craves not these things. You are reckless.'

front.title: •Much Anger In Him (V)
front.gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on opponent's non-droid, non-Jedi Master character (or 2 Force on a Rebel). Character's game text is canceled and they draw one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Opponent may lose three cards from hand (may not be reduced) to cancel this Effect.
front.lore: 'Adventure, heh. Excitement, heh. A Jedi craves not these things. You are reckless.'

front.title: Multi Troop Transport
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 7 passengers. Your battle droids may move from this site for free. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Vehicle utilized by the Trade Federation droid army. 31 meters tall. Capable of holding, transporting, and deploying up to 112 battle droids. Enclosed.

front.title: •Murttoc Yine
front.gametext: During your control phase, if at a Jabba's Palace site you control, may use 3 Force to search your Reserve Deck, take one other alien that is a smuggler, information broker, thief or spy into hand and reshuffle.
front.lore: Information broker. Spy. Has many nefarious contacts in the underworld. Contact point for many seeking employment with Jabba.

combo: Murttoc Yine + Nevar Yalnal

front.title: •Mustafar
front.gametext: Dark:  Once per turn, may use 1 Force to deploy a Mustafar site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Light:  While Vader on table, unless Amidala at a Mustafar location, Force drain -1 here.

front.title: •Mustafar: Vader's Castle
front.gametext: Dark:  Once per game, may deploy Vader here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. During your move phase, Vader may move between here and any battleground site.  Light:

front.title: •Muunilinst
front.gametext: Dark:  If you control, attrition against opponent in battles on Muunilinst is +1.  Light:  If you control, attrition against opponent in battles on Muunilinst is +1.

front.title: •Muunilinst: Banking Clan Headquarters
front.gametext: Dark:  If you control with a [Separatist] card, unique (•) [Separatist] cards deploy -1 here.  Light:  Your combat vehicles and [Clone Army] cards are power +1 here.

front.title: •Muunilinst: City of Harnaidan
front.gametext: Dark:  Your combat vehicles here are power +1 and may move to and from here for free  Light:  Unless your combat vehicles or [Clone Army] card here, Force drain -1 here.

front.title: •Muunilinst: Docking Bay
front.gametext: Dark:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force (free if a [Separatist] card here).  Light:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.

front.title: •Muunilinst: Separatist Command Center
front.gametext: Dark:  Battle droids and [Separatist] cards here are power +1.  Light:  Blank

front.title: My Kind Of Scum / Fearless And Inventive
front.gametext: My Kind Of Scum:Deploy Desert Heart and a Jabba's Palace site. May deploy Well Guarded. Reveal one unique (•) alien from your deck whose lore specifies its species. This card is your Rep.{For} remainder of game, your Rep is a leader. Well Guarded is immune to Alter. You may not deploy 'insert' cards or operatives. While frozen Han on table, Rebels are immune to No Bargain and Bad Feeling Have I.{Flip} this card if you occupy two battleground sites (must occupy a third with a non-unique alien of your Rep's species if a non-Tatooine location is on table).Fearless And Inventive:{While} this side up, once per turn you may cancel a Force drain or a just-drawn battle destiny by placing here from hand a copy of your Rep. Once during each of your control phases, you may retrieve a non-unique alien of your Rep's species. While Jabba and Bib on table, your battle destiny draws are each +2. Wounded Wookiee is destiny +3. Unless a non-Tatooine location is on table, your aliens are forfeit +2. For remainder of game, your Rep may deploy from here as if from hand.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy 2 battleground sites.

back.title: My Kind Of Scum / Fearless And Inventive
back.gametext: My Kind Of Scum:Deploy Desert Heart and a Jabba's Palace site. May deploy Well Guarded. Reveal one unique (•) alien from your deck whose lore specifies its species. This card is your Rep.{For} remainder of game, your Rep is a leader. Well Guarded is immune to Alter. You may not deploy 'insert' cards or operatives. While frozen Han on table, Rebels are immune to No Bargain and Bad Feeling Have I.{Flip} this card if you occupy two battleground sites (must occupy a third with a non-unique alien of your Rep's species if a non-Tatooine location is on table).Fearless And Inventive:{While} this side up, once per turn you may cancel a Force drain or a just-drawn battle destiny by placing here from hand a copy of your Rep. Once during each of your control phases, you may retrieve a non-unique alien of your Rep's species. While Jabba and Bib on table, your battle destiny draws are each +2. Wounded Wookiee is destiny +3. Unless a non-Tatooine location is on table, your aliens are forfeit +2. For remainder of game, your Rep may deploy from here as if from hand.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy 2 battleground sites.

front.title: My Lord, Is That Legal? / I Will Make It Legal
front.gametext: My Lord, Is That Legal?:Deploy Galactic Senate and any other [Episode I] location.{For} remainder of game, Rebel and Imperial leaders of ability < 4 are politics +2. Counter Assault and Surprise Assault are canceled. Your Republic characters are immune to Goo Nee Tay. Cards on your Political Effects may deploy to table. At Galactic Senate, weapon destiny draws are -6, creatures are lost and game text of non-Republic characters is canceled.{Flip} this card if you have 3 senators (or 2 senators, at least 1 with a blockade agenda) at Galactic Senate.I Will Make It Legal:{While} this side up, once during your control phase may use 3 Force to place up to two random cards from opponent's hand into their Used Pile. Once per turn may take a Political Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your senators are destiny +2 (or +3 if senator has an ambition agenda) when drawn for weapon or battle destiny. May use 2 Force at end of any turn to place all cards on your Political Effects into Used Pile.{Flip} this card if you have less than two senators at Galactic Senate.

back.title: My Lord, Is That Legal? / I Will Make It Legal
back.gametext: My Lord, Is That Legal?:Deploy Galactic Senate and any other [Episode I] location.{For} remainder of game, Rebel and Imperial leaders of ability < 4 are politics +2. Counter Assault and Surprise Assault are canceled. Your Republic characters are immune to Goo Nee Tay. Cards on your Political Effects may deploy to table. At Galactic Senate, weapon destiny draws are -6, creatures are lost and game text of non-Republic characters is canceled.{Flip} this card if you have 3 senators (or 2 senators, at least 1 with a blockade agenda) at Galactic Senate.I Will Make It Legal:{While} this side up, once during your control phase may use 3 Force to place up to two random cards from opponent's hand into their Used Pile. Once per turn may take a Political Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your senators are destiny +2 (or +3 if senator has an ambition agenda) when drawn for weapon or battle destiny. May use 2 Force at end of any turn to place all cards on your Political Effects into Used Pile.{Flip} this card if you have less than two senators at Galactic Senate.

front.title: •Myn Kyneugh
front.gametext: Deploys only on Coruscant or to Emperor's site (or related site). When armed with a Force pike, adds one battle destiny. Your troopers and Royal Guards may 'react' to here for free. Adds 1 to defense value of other Royal Guards at same and related sites.
front.lore: Royal guard leader. Remembers nothing of his past other than serving his Emperor. Early instructor of Kir Kanos and Carnor Jax.

front.title: •Myn Kyneugh (V)
front.gametext: When deployed, may play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect (as if from hand). While at opponent's battleground, Force drains here may not be reduced. Once per game, may use 1 Force to place opponent's just-played Interrupt out of play.
front.lore: Royal guard leader. Remembers nothing of his past other than serving his Emperor. Early instructor of Kir Kanos and Carnor Jax.

front.title: •Myn Kyneugh (V)
front.gametext: Heroic. When deployed, may play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect (as if from hand). Force Pike is a matching weapon for Myn, and, when using it, it fires for free and his total weapon destiny is +1. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Royal guard leader. Remembers nothing of his past other than serving his Emperor. Early instructor of Kir Kanos and Carnor Jax.

front.title: Mynock
front.gametext: Habitat: unlimited. Parasite: Starfighter. Host's power and hyperspeed are cumulatively -2; while both < 1, Mynocks randomly detach one at a time (cannot attach for remainder of turn). Moves like a starfighter.
front.lore: Silicon-based space borne lifeform. Frequently called a 'power sucker.' Feeds on energy such as stellar radiation and electrical discharges. Absorbs minerals from starship hulks.

front.title: •Myo
front.gametext: Power +1 if present with Lirin Car'n or any bounty hunter. If lost or forfeited as a result of a battle, Myo 'regenerates' (place on top of your Used Pile).
front.lore: A regenerating, primitive, violent, desert dwelling, fearless, mercenary-joining, Lirin Car'n-befriending, cyclopian Abyssin from Byss. Calling him 'monoc' will start a fight.

combo: Myo + Bounty Hunters = Protect your low forefeit bounty hunters by throwing Myo in the way.
Myo + Lone Warrior + Moment of Triumph = You only lose the destiny adders.

front.title: •Naboo
front.gametext: Dark:  If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Naboo sites.  Light:  If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Naboo sites.

front.title: Naboo Blaster
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your warrior or battle droid. May target a character, creature, or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.
front.lore: Weapons were confiscated by battle droids during the Trade Federation's occupation of Naboo. Considered superior to blasters manufactured in the Outer Rim.

front.title: Naboo Blaster Rifle
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your warrior or battle droid. May target a character, creature, or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +2 > defense value.
front.lore: A large quantity of these blasters found their way onto the black market after the Trade Federation's blockade of Naboo failed.

front.title: •Naboo Occupation
front.gametext: Deploy on table. During your draw phase, may use 3 Force: until end of next turn, opponent generates no Force at Naboo sites you control with a battle droid. Place Effect in Lost Pile if you have no battle droids on Naboo. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Battle droid armies require less credits to maintain than the average soldier. Trade Federation tactics are designed to take advantage of these numbers.

front.title: •Naboo: Battle Plains
front.gametext: Dark:  Unless Gungan Energy Shield on table, your AATs are each power +2 here.  Light:  Once per game may take Gungan Energy Shield into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

front.title: •Naboo: Swamp
front.gametext: Dark:  If your battle droid present, Force drain +1 here.  Light:  If your Gungan present, Force drain +1 here.

front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Courtyard
front.gametext: Dark:  During your move phase, may move your characters from here to any interior Naboo site.  Light:  Add 1 to each of your weapon destiny draws here.

front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Docking Bay
front.gametext: Dark:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.  Light:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.

front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Generator
front.gametext: Dark:  Your Dark Jedi are power +2 here.  Light:  Your Jedi are power +1 here. Force drain -1 here.

front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Generator Core
front.gametext: Dark:  Any characters of ability < 5 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.  Light:  Any characters of ability < 5 'hit' here (and all cards on them) are placed in owner's Used Pile.

front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Hallway
front.gametext: Dark:  Once per game, may deploy a battle droid here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Light:  Force drain -1 here.

front.title: •Naboo: Theed Palace Throne Room
front.gametext: Dark:  If Haako or Gunray present, Force drain +1 here.  Light:  Unless Amidala present, Force drain -1 here.

front.title: •Nal Hutta
front.gametext: Dark:  During your control phase, may search Reserve Deck, take one Bounty or Hutt Bounty into hand; reshuffle.  Light:  If you control, Force drain -1 here and opponent's Nal Hutta game text is canceled.

combo: Nal Hutta + Vengeance Vengeance is power +2 at Nal Hutta.

front.title: Nal Hutta Operative
front.gametext: While at a Nal Hutta site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is power +1 (or +2 if your gangster or Rodian is on Nal Hutta) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Nal Hutta from Reserve Deck- reshuffle.
front.lore: Strong-armed H'nemthe thugs working for the Hutts. Work alongside Rodians and other unscrupulous aliens.

front.title: Navy Trooper
front.gametext: Deploy -1 to a mobile site (except on Cloud City). When defending a battle, power +1 (or +2 if also at an interior site). When in battle against an operative, prevents opponent from drawing more than one battle destiny.
front.lore: Navy troopers are assigned to defend key installations. Trained to protect against alien species and other insurgents.

front.title: •Navy Trooper Fenson
front.gametext: Subtracts 3 from Force opponent retrieves for On The Edge and Off The Edge. When at Bunker, adds 2 to deploy cost of each opponent's character (except Ewoks, spies and scouts) to Endor sites (except Rebel Landing Site).
front.lore: Rendili native skilled at close-quarters combat. Worked with Trooper Vesden to monitor enemy activity on Endor.

front.title: •••Navy Trooper Shield Technician
front.gametext: Forfeit +2 while with Hewex. When at Bunker (or aboard a Star Destroyer at Endor), cumulatively adds 1 to deploy cost of each opponent's starship and non-Ewok vehicle deploying to Endor (or to your mobile site orbiting Endor)
front.lore: Many Imperial Navy troopers receive technical as well as combat training, which they use to maintain the Empire's military facilities.

front.title: •Navy Trooper Vesden
front.gametext: If present with a Scomp link when Never Tell Me The Odds just reached the top of your Reserve Deck, may 'shield' (add 3 to destiny number of) one of your characters at each location for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Counterintelligence agent assigned by ISB. Operates sensors designed to protect the control bunker from infiltration.

front.title: •Nebit
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. When in a battle with at least two of your other Jawas, adds one battle destiny. When your total battle destiny at Nebit's site is greater than opponent's total battle destiny, Nebit reduces attrition against you by 3.
front.lore: Jawa leader responsible for organizing raids on rival Jawa factions. Detested warrior. Hates being 'frocked.'

pulledBy: Herat to deploy to same location

front.title: •Neimoidian Advisor
front.gametext: USED: Use 2 Force to deploy a unique (•) battleground not on table, from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  STARTING: Deploy from your Reserve Deck one Effect which deploys on table (or your side of table) and has no deploy cost; reshuffle. Place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: 'We must move quickly to disrupt all communication down there.'

pulls: A unique battleground not on table:
One Effect which deploys on table and has no deploy cost

front.title: Neimoidian Pilot
front.gametext: Deploys -2 at Naboo. When deployed aboard your battleship, you may activate 1 Force. Adds 2 to the power of any starship he pilots. Forfeit +2 while piloting.
front.lore: Trade Federation Neimodian pilots are some of the most desired in the galaxy due to their willingness to follow orders.

front.title: Nevar Yalnal
front.gametext: If both players have a spy at same site, draw destiny. Add 2 if opponent's spy is Undercover. Opponent's spy is lost if destiny > 2.
front.lore: Immense Ranat scavenger from Aralia. Slyly spies for anyone willing to pay his price. Outcast. Works as a laborer for Hrchek, the Saurin droid trader.

combo: Nevar Yalnal + Dark Side spy

front.title: Ng'ok
front.gametext: If opponent just deployed four or more characters to same location this turn, prevent all of those characters from battling this turn. OR if opponent just 'reacted' to a battle, cancel the battle.
front.lore: Dejarik of a Ng'ok war beast. Foul temper gives rise to bad feelings.

cards.counterpart: I Have A Very Bad Feeling About This
cancels: A battle opponent has just reacted to

front.title: •Ng'ok War Beast
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If your character, starship, or vehicle in battle is about to be lost before the damage segment, it is instead lost at end of battle (if forfeited, forfeit for 0). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Dejarik.

front.title: •Ni Chuba Na??
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per turn may use 1 Force to look through opponent's Lost Pile and place all docking bays you find there out of play. Once per game may deploy Sebulba from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Your buddy here was about to be turned into orange goo. He picked a fight with a Dug. An especially dangerous Dug called Sebulba.'

front.title: •Ni Chuba Na?? (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Your Force generation is +1.  Once per game, may relocate this Effect to a site.  At same and related locations, Revolution is canceled and your cards may not have their deploy costs modified by Goo Nee Tay.  Security Precautions is canceled. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Your buddy here was about to be turned into orange goo. He picked a fight with a Dug. An especially dangerous Dug called Sebulba.'

front.title: •Niado Duegad
front.gametext: May not carry or use devices or weapons. Once per turn, may use X Force, where X = 1, 2, or 3, to add twice X to his power for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Mercenary from Vodran. Niado's culture controls its environment through terraforming facilities. Enhanced adrenal glands allow for short bursts of incredible strength.

front.title: Nikto
front.gametext: Deploys only to a Jabba's Palace site. Power and forfeit +2 when defending a battle at a Jabba's Palace site.
front.lore: Several different types if Nikto were sold to Jabba by slavers. Compete with Weequay to prove themselves the stronger species.

front.title: •Nizuc Bek
front.gametext: Power +3 when present with your musician. When present at the start of a battle, may cause one character of ability < X to move away for free (or that character is immediately lost) where X = the number of your musicians present.
front.lore: Guard from Corulag. Former bouncer at the Mos Eisley cantina. Assigned by Jabba to guard celebrities visiting Jabba's palace. Friend of Wuher. Loves juri juice.

front.title: •Nizuc Bek (V)
front.gametext: Whenever opponent Force drains at a non-battleground, may retrieve 1 Force. During your deploy phase, may deploy an Effect with 'matching' in game text from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, may place Juri Juice from hand on Force Pile to cancel a Force drain.
front.lore: Guard from Corulag. Former bouncer at the Mos Eisley cantina. Assigned by Jabba to guard celebrities visiting Jabba's palace. Friend of Wuher. Loves juri juice.

front.title: •No Bargain
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. While no Imperials are at any Jabba's Palace sites: Rebels are deploy +2, Revolution is canceled and your non-unique aliens are each forfeit +1. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Zeet tu seet. Jabba no tuzindy honkabee.'

front.title: •No Bargain (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on your [Reflections II] Objective; 'Xizor' on it (and on Guri) is treated as 'Shada'. Non-[Permanent Weapon] alien females are Mistryl and Black Sun agents. You may not deploy cards with ability except Mistryl and [Independent Starship] starships. Mistryl (except Kitik) are power +1 (+2 if unique (•)), and, while Scum And Villainy on table, deploy +1. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Zeet tu seet. Jabba no tuzindy honkabee.'

front.title: •No Civility, Only Politics
front.gametext: USED: During your move phase, take one of your characters with politics at Galactic Senate into hand.  LOST: If you have a Republic character with politics in battle at a site, add one battle destiny; that character is power and politics = 0 until end of turn.
front.lore: It's not rare to see a senator using the system to forward his own personal agenda. Much goes on behind closed doors that the Senate never sees.

front.title: •No Escape
front.gametext: Deploy on table. You may immediately take top card of Lost Pile into hand. Effects, Epic Events, and Objectives are immune to Honor Of The Jedi. At each opponent's <> site, your characters and vehicles are each deploy -3 and your Force generation is +1. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Jabba's influence is not easily ignored. Neither are his voracious and vile appetites. Even Jedi soon learn this lesson.

pulls: Top card of Lost Pile into hand

front.title: •No Escape
front.gametext: Plays on table. At opponent's <> site where opponent's creature present, you may deploy without presence or Force icons, and your Force generation there is +1.
front.lore: Jabba's influence is not easily ignored. Neither are his voracious and vile appetites. Even Jedi soon learn this lesson.

front.title: •No Escape (Premium) (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy a Subjugated Planet location, operatives are forfeit = 0, operatives do not add to Force drains, and your Force drains may not be reduced. Nudjs do not cancel Force icons.
front.lore: Jabba's influence is not easily ignored. Neither are his voracious and vile appetites. Even Jedi soon learn this lesson.

front.title: •No Escape (V)
front.gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy a Subjugated Planet location, operatives are forfeit = 0, operatives do not add to Force drains, and your Force drains may not be reduced. Nudjs do not cancel Force icons.
front.lore: Jabba's influence is not easily ignored. Neither are his voracious and vile appetites. Even Jedi soon learn this lesson.

front.title: •No Match For A Sith
front.gametext: If Maul armed with a lightsaber in battle, use 2 Force to draw two destiny. Opponent draws two destiny. If any of your destinies equal any of opponent's destinies, opponent's Jedi is power = 0 for remainder of battle.
front.lore: Lightsaber duels are so fast and furious that Jedi don't plan their offensive strategy, but instead rely on instinct and their ability to sense an opponent's next strike.

front.title: No Money, No Parts, No Deal! / You're A Slave?
front.gametext: No Money, No Parts, No Deal!:Deploy Watto's Junkyard and Mos Espa.{For} remainder of game, Watto's Junkyard is immune to Revolution. If Watto at Watto's Junkyard, opponent may use 8 Force to place Watto in Used Pile and you may retrieve up to 4 Force.{While} this side up, Qui-Gon is power +3. Opponent loses no more than 1 Force from your Force drains at Tatooine sites.{Flip} this card if Watto present at Watto's Junkyard and you occupy Mos Espa.You're A Slave?:{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may place a card from hand face down on your side of the table and opponent must choose to lose 2 Force (you place card in Used Pile) or use 2 Force (you deploy that card for free). If opponent uses 2 Force and you cannot deploy card, lose 2 Force and card is lost. Opponent's non-unique aliens are each deploy +3.{Flip} this card if Watto not present at Watto's Junkyard or you do not occupy Mos Espa.

back.title: No Money, No Parts, No Deal! / You're A Slave?
back.gametext: No Money, No Parts, No Deal!:Deploy Watto's Junkyard and Mos Espa.{For} remainder of game, Watto's Junkyard is immune to Revolution. If Watto at Watto's Junkyard, opponent may use 8 Force to place Watto in Used Pile and you may retrieve up to 4 Force.{While} this side up, Qui-Gon is power +3. Opponent loses no more than 1 Force from your Force drains at Tatooine sites.{Flip} this card if Watto present at Watto's Junkyard and you occupy Mos Espa.You're A Slave?:{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may place a card from hand face down on your side of the table and opponent must choose to lose 2 Force (you place card in Used Pile) or use 2 Force (you deploy that card for free). If opponent uses 2 Force and you cannot deploy card, lose 2 Force and card is lost. Opponent's non-unique aliens are each deploy +3.{Flip} this card if Watto not present at Watto's Junkyard or you do not occupy Mos Espa.

front.title: None Shall Pass
front.gametext: If opponent just deployed a Rebel to a Jabba's Palace site, (and you have no Imperials at a Jabba's Palace site), return Rebel to opponents hand. Any Force used to deploy that Rebel remains used, and Rebel may not be deployed for the remainder of the turn.
front.lore: Jabba's Gamorrean guards keep a watchful eye for unwelcome guests.

front.title: None Shall Pass (V)
front.gametext: If opponent just deployed a character (except Leia) to a Jabba's Palace site, use 1 Force to place that character on bottom of opponent's Force Pile (opponent may draw two cards from Reserve Deck).
front.lore: Jabba's Gamorrean guards keep a watchful eye for unwelcome guests.

front.title: •Nothing Can Get Through Our Shield
front.gametext: Non-pilot characters aboard starships are forfeit -4. Whenever a player's starship is 'hit', that player loses 1 Force (2 if starship was hit by Droid Starfighter Laser Cannons). At systems where you have only [Trade Federation] starships, all of those starships are immune to attrition < 4. At sites related to a system you occupy, your battle destinies may not be canceled by opponent.

front.title: •Nothing Can Get Through Our Shield (V)
front.gametext: At each system a player controls with a capital starship, his non-[Presence] characters and vehicles deploy -1 to related sites and sectors. If you occupy a system with a capital starship (or three unique starships) and have no Objective on table, may add 1 to each of your Force drains at related battleground sites (opponent loses no more than 2 Force from those drains).

front.title: •Nute Gunray
front.gametext: Your destroyer droids and battle droids are each forfeit +1 at same and related sites. While aboard Blockade Flagship, opponent's Jedi may not move or deploy to Bridge, and your destroyer droids are destiny +3 if drawn for battle destiny.
front.lore: Commanding Viceroy of the Trade Federation forces assigned to the blockade of Naboo. Takes for his own actions. Neimoidian leader.

front.title: •Nute Gunray (V)
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Council Room. Adds 1 to any attempt to 'align' a system. If you have an 'aligned' system on table, once per turn during any battle, may lose 1 Force to add 1 to your total power for each unique (•) [Separatist] character on table.

front.title: •Nute Gunray (V)
front.gametext: During battle, may cancel game text of a Republic character with ability with ability < 4 present. If with your Republic character (or character with 'Trade Federation' in lore), may add one battle destiny. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Commanding Viceroy of the Trade Federation forces assigned to the blockade of Naboo. Takes for his own actions. Neimoidian leader.

front.title: •Nute Gunray, Neimoidian Viceroy
front.gametext: Your [Presence] droids and AATs are destiny +1 if drawn for battle or weapon destiny. Once per turn, may take Take Them Away into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < X, where X = twice the number of [Presence] droids present.
front.lore: Neimoidian leader. Viceroy to the Trade Federation, but primarily under the influence of Darth Sidious. Ordered to take control of Naboo, and force the Queen to sign a treaty.

front.title: •Nute Gunray, Neimoidian Viceroy (AI)
front.gametext: Your [Presence] droids and AATs are destiny +1 if drawn for battle or weapon destiny. Once per turn, may take Take Them Away into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < X, where X = twice the number of [Presence] droids present.
front.lore: Neimoidian leader. Viceroy to the Trade Federation, but primarily under the influence of Darth Sidious. Ordered to take control of Naboo, and force the Queen to sign a treaty.

front.title: •Nute Gunray's Bounty
front.gametext: Deploy on Amidala or opponent's senator. During your move phase, unless a Jedi here, your alien bounty hunter present may capture and seize that character. During your control phase, if that character is escorted by an alien, opponent loses 1 Force.
front.lore: Palpatine suggested to the Queen that she acquiesce to the Trade Federation, just for the time being

front.title: •Nysad
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. May deploy as a 'react' to a Jabba's Palace site or aboard a vehicle at a Tatooine site. Power +3 when defending a battle at a Jabba's Palace site.
front.lore: Kajain'sa'Nikto. Fiercely loyal to Jabba. Stands guard over the sail barge during the Hutt's many trips to Mos Eisley.

front.title: Observation Holocam
front.gametext: Deploy on a site. Adds 1 to the total weapon destiny of each of your automated weapons at same and adjacent sites. During battle, may add the power of one of your characters at an adajcent site you control to your total.
front.lore: Remote surveillance viewers with droid controllers supplement security. Can activate alarms and automated weapons when needed, bringing help to endangered locations.

front.title: •Obsidian 10
front.gametext: May deploy with a pilot as a 'react' to any asteroid sector or cloud sector. May add one pilot. OS-72-10 deploys -2 aboard.
front.lore: Recalled to defend second Death Star during construction. Stationed aboard Thunderflare.

pulledBy: Short Range Fighters & Watch Your Back!

front.title: •Obsidian 10 (V)
front.gametext: Heroic. May add 1 pilot. OS-72-10 deploys -2 aboard. When lost from Endor, a mobile system, or a sector, may place this starship (and cards aboard it) in owner's Used Pile.
front.lore: Recalled to defend second Death Star during construction. Stationed aboard Thunderflare.

front.title: •Obsidian 7
front.gametext: Deploy -1 and power +3 at any cloud sector. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2.
front.lore: TIE fighter modified for upper atmosphere maneuvers. Pilot nicknamed 'Winged Gundark' due to the number of kills earned in highaltitude battles.

front.title: •Obsidian 8
front.gametext: Deploy -1 and power +3 at any cloud sector. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: Modified TIE fighter. Used most often to pursue raiders attempting to take refuge in the upper atmosphere of nearby planets. Pilot previously stationed aboard Devastator.

front.title: •••Obsidian Squadron TIE
front.gametext: Deploy -1 at any cloud sector. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Power +2 at non-unique cloud sectors. Boosted TIE Cannon may deploy aboard and fires free aboard.
front.lore: Modified TIE fighter. Specifically adapted for atmospheric engagement. Some are fitted with high-output solar panels to support improved weaponry.

front.title: •Occupied Territory
front.gametext: Deploy on a battleground. If you occupy, during battle here or at a related location, may place this Effect in Used Pile and choose: Draw up to two cards from Reserve Deck OR Prevent any destinies from being drawn during the power segment of that battle (except battle destiny).
front.lore: 'I advise everyone to leave before more Imperial troops arrive.'

front.title: •Officer Evax
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When at a Death Star site, Imperial starships may move to the Death Star system as a 'react.'
front.lore: This Imperial Intelligence leader has a proven track record for predicting Rebel fleet movements. His coordination of starship maneuvers has saved many vulnerable bases.

front.title: •Officer Evax (V)
front.gametext: Imperial Council Member. Agenda: logistics. Once per turn, if at Conference Room, may target an opponent's starship on table with power < total influence here. Opponent must use +2 Force to move target (or initiate battle there) this turn.
front.lore: This Imperial Intelligence leader has a proven track record for predicting Rebel fleet movements. His coordination of starship maneuvers has saved many vulnerable bases.

front.title: Oh, Switch Off
front.gametext: Cancel an attempt by opponent to target your droid to be stolen, 'hit' or lost. Droid is protected from all such attempts for remainder of turn. OR Switch OFF any binary droid for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Mindless philosophy for an overweight glob of grease.

cancels: An attempt by opponent to target your droid to be stolen

front.title: •Ominous Rumors
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on Endor system if opponent controls no Endor sites. Your Force drains are +2 at up to X other battleground systems, where X = number of Endor sites you occupy. Effect canceled if opponent controls three Endor sites. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Rumors of a new 'technological terror' filled the galaxy with dread.

combo: Ominous Rumors + Security Precautions
Ominous Rumors + Colonel Dyer
Ominous Rumors + Endor: Bunker + Perimeter Patrol

front.title: •Ominous Rumors (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Bunker. Your scouts aboard speeder bikes are defense value = 5 and immune to Clash of Sabers. Once per turn, if you control Bunker, may deploy an [Endor icon] Imperial here (except Fenson or Grond) or a forest from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Canceled if opponent controls at least three Endor Sites. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Rumors of a new 'technological terror' filled the galaxy with dread.

front.title: Ommni Box
front.gametext: Shuffle any player's Reserve Deck or Lost Pile or Used Pile.
front.lore: Difficult-to-play instrument which enhances music. Tech Mo'r plays one for Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes in the Mos Eisley Cantina.

front.title: Ommni Box & It's Worse
front.gametext: USED: Shuffle any player's Reserve Deck or Lost Pile.  LOST: If It Could Be Worse was just played, it is canceled and you may use X Force to raise damage against opponent by X amount. OR If opponent just lost Force from a battle, play to increase loss by 1 Force.

front.title: •On The Hunt
front.gametext: Deploy on Contract Killers. Assassins are defense value +1. Once per game, may retrieve (Virtual Block 8) Death Mark. At the end of opponent's turn, if their character targeted by (Virtual Block 8) Death Mark is at a non-battleground or aboard their starship, opponent loses 3 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •On The Payroll Of The Trade Federation
front.gametext: Target an opponent's character at Galactic Senate if you have a senator there with a matching agenda. For remainder of turn: your senator's politics is increased by target's current politics, and target's politics is then reduced to zero.
front.lore: A political agenda is no use without supporters. And in the world of politics, left and right often meet in the middle.

front.title: •One Beautiful Thing
front.gametext: Lose 1 Force to take Juno Eclipse into hand from Reserve Deck (or retrieve); reshuffle. OR During battle where you have no Dark Jedi or droids and only two participating cards with ability (a male and a female), add one destiny to total power (and attrition against you = 0).
front.lore: 'I don't know how we're gonna get out of this one.'

front.title: •One Bright Spot
front.gametext: If Galen was just lost and Juno Eclipse is on table (or vice versa), place the just-lost character on your Used Pile instead. OR If Juno Eclipse is participating in a battle, you may lose Galen from hand to satisfy all battle damage and attrition against you.
front.lore: Even a Jedi cannot always foresee future events.

front.title: •One-Arm
front.gametext: Habitat: Hoth sites. Deploys only to Wampa Cave. For remainder of game, all wampas are selective creatures.
front.lore: When a wampa is wounded, the other members of its pack band together to repel the threat.

combo: Bog-wing Bog-wing Mynock Mynock Nudj One-Arm Scurrier Sleen Vine Snake Vine Snake

front.title: •One-Arm (V)
front.gametext: Habitat: Hoth sites. Deploys only to a marker site. Wampas are [Selective Creature] creatures. Other wampas are ferocity and defense value +2. Once per game, may deploy Wampa Cave on table from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: When a wampa is wounded, the other members of its pack band together to repel the threat.

front.title: •Onyx 1
front.gametext: May deploy -2 with a pilot as a 'react' to same location as any Imperial-class Star Destroyer. May add 1 pilot. Any starship cannon may deploy aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when Jendon piloting.
front.lore: Designed to emulate Rebel starfighter advantages. Production began shortly before the Battle of Endor. Armed with laser cannons, ion cannons and missile launchers.

pulledBy: Short Range Fighters & Watch Your Back!

front.title: •Onyx 2
front.gametext: Deploys for free to any mobile system. May deploy with a pilot as a 'react'. May add 1 pilot. Any starship cannon may deploy aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when Yorr piloting.
front.lore: Part of limited production run of TIE defenders. Testing of the prototype defender indicated the need for a more powerful hyperdrive, which was added for this production model.

pulledBy: Short Range Fighters & Watch Your Back!

front.title: •Onyx 2 (V)
front.gametext: May deploy as a 'react'. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. When deployed (except as a 'react'), may play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect (as if from hand).
front.lore: Part of limited production run of TIE defenders. Testing of the prototype defender indicated the need for a more powerful hyperdrive, which was added for this production model.

front.title: •Onyx 2 (V)
front.gametext: May deploy as a 'react'. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. When deployed (except as a 'react'), may play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect (as if from hand).
front.lore: Part of limited production run of TIE defenders. Testing of the prototype defender indicated the need for a more powerful hyperdrive, which was added for this production model.

front.title: Oo-ta Goo-ta, Solo?
front.gametext: If Nabrun Leids just completed a transport, use 2 Force. Nabrun is lost and all Rebels transported are captured. (Immune to Sense.) OR Prevent a just-deployed smuggler from moving this turn. OR Cancel a Kessel Run.
front.lore: Greedo cheskopokuta klees ruya Solo. Hoko yanee boopa gush Cantina. Cheeco wa Solo's anye nyuma Greedo vakee. Jabba kul steeka et en anpaw.

cancels: Captures all Rebels transported by Nabrun Leids

front.title: Oo-ta Goo-ta, Solo? (V)
front.gametext: USED: During battle at a site where your alien bounty hunter (except Boba Fett) is with opponent's smuggler, opponent may not draw more than one battle destiny.  LOST: During battle at a site where you have an alien bounty hunter, add one battle destiny.
front.lore: Greedo cheskopokuta klees ruya Solo. Hoko yanee boopa gush Cantina. Cheeco wa Solo's anye nyuma Greedo vakee. Jabba kul steeka et en anpaw.

front.title: Oo-ta Goo-ta, Solo? (V)
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Nabrun Leids (Immune to Sense) OR Use 1 Force to take a Rodian (or a non-unique alien of your Rep's species) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: During your move phase, 'break cover' of an Undercover spy.
front.lore: Greedo cheskopokuta klees ruya Solo. Hoko yanee boopa gush Cantina. Cheeco wa Solo's anye nyuma Greedo vakee. Jabba kul steeka et en anpaw.

front.title: ••OOM Command Battle Droid
front.gametext: [Pilot]2: any vehicle. While piloting a [Theed Palace] vehicle at a battleground site: adds 1 [Dark Side] here and may add 1 to your Force drains here. Once per game, may take into hand any a card with 'fire' in title from reserve deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Commander. Leader.

front.title: •OOM-9
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. May add or subtract one from a just drawn Energy Shell weapon destiny draw here. While at Battle Plains, twice per game may take Open Fire! or Cease Fire! into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Officer battle droid who acted as a unit leader in the attack against the Gungans. Required advice from the Droid Control Ship in order to defeat the Gungan energy shield.

combo: OOM-9 + Daultay Dofine

front.title: •OOM-9 (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. While at a battleground, you lose no force to Amidala and your force generation is +1 for each of opponent's non-battlegrounds on table (and cards stacked on their Epic Events).
front.lore: Officer battle droid who acted as a unit leader in the attack against the Gungans. Required advice from the Droid Control Ship in order to defeat the Gungan energy shield.

front.title: •Opee Sea Killer
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Cancels Sando Aqua Monster. While no card here, may place an opponent's just-drawn battle destiny face-up here. If opponent just drew battle destiny with the same card title as card here, place both cards in opponent's Lost Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: With a vicious array of pointed teeth, the opee sea killer is a fearsome hunter. When outmatched in size, it uses small crevices to avoid bigger predators.

front.title: •Open Fire!
front.gametext: Deploy on your AAT. Once during your control phase may use 3 Force to fire your AAT Laser Cannon on this AAT for free.
front.lore: When given the attack coordinates, AAT weaponry can be programmed to track and fire automatically for maximum destruction.

front.title: •Operational As Planned
front.gametext: USED: Place one card from hand on top of Force Pile.  STARTING: If Endor system on table, take Death Star II system, Jerjerrod and any Effect into hand from Reserve Deck. When you draw your starting hand, draw only six more cards. Place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: 'We shall double our efforts.'

combo: Operational As Planned + Janus Greejatus

front.title: •Operational As Planned (V)
front.gametext: Once per turn, if taken into hand using Protocol Failure, may immediately reveal this Interrupt to return Protocol Failure from Lost Pile to hand.  Use 1 Force to take [Virtual Block 6] Grotto Werribee or an Immediate Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  OR Use 2 Force to take an Effect that deploys for free into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: 'We shall double our efforts.'

front.title: •Operational As Planned (V)
front.gametext: USED: Use 1 Force to deploy Krennic or a Jedha location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  STARTING: If Death Star on table, deploy Superlaser and up to two Effects that deploy on table and are always immune to Alter. Place this Interrupt in hand.
front.lore: 'We shall double our efforts.'

front.title: •Oppressive Enforcement
front.gametext: Plays on table. Your Immediate Effects may play for free. Whenever opponent cancels your card with Sense or Alter, place that canceled card in Used Pile.
front.lore: The Imperial fleet keeps a tight grip on the systems under its control. Abuses and excesses by local citizens are not tolerated.

front.title: •Oppressive Enforcement
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Your Imperial capital starships are each destiny +1. Your Immediate Effects may deploy for free. Whenever opponent cancels your card with Sense or Alter, place that canceled card in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Imperial fleet keeps a tight grip on the systems under its control. Abuses and excesses by local citizens are not tolerated.

combo: Opressive Enforcement + Twi'lek Advisor
Opressive Enforcement + There'll Be Hell To Pay + Tentacle
Opressive Enforcement + Dreadnaughts Destiny 4 support cards for a TIE deck.

front.title: •Ord Mantell
front.gametext: Dark:  Your Bounty Hunters are deploy -2 here.  Light:  (none)

front.title: Ord Mantell Operative
front.gametext: While at an Ord Mantell site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is power +1 (or +2 if your bounty hunter is on Ord Mantell) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Ord Mantell from Reserve Deck- reshuffle.
front.lore: Many Aqualish draft and maintain bounty hunting contracts for the Empire, the Hutts or anyone with credits. Fight against the Alliance to avoid losing their best customer.

front.title: •Order 66
front.gametext: Deploy on Sidious.  If with [Virtual Block 5] Expand the Empire during your control phase: relocate this card to an [Episode I] Jedi at a battleground or Senate (otherwise, retrieve 1 Force).  If on a Jedi, add one battle destiny here, and if that Jedi just lost, relocate this card to Sidious.
front.lore: Hologram.

front.title: •Organa's Ceremonial Necklace
front.gametext: Deploy on any Yavin 4 site. Target one Imperial. When Imperial reaches target site, 'steal' necklace. Whenever necklace is present during Force drain: add 1 to Force drain and may then pass (for free) to an adjacent site you control (if any), and so on.
front.lore: Necklace worn by Princess Leia during the awards ceremony after the Battle of Yavin. A powerful artifact in the Alderaanian royal family for dozens of generations.

front.title: •Organa's Ceremonial Necklace (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. While you have < 13 cards in hand, opponent may not peek at or remove those cards (except with Grimtaash). May lose 2 Force to target two [Coruscant] Political Effects; opponent may not place cards on either until the next time you use this text. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Necklace worn by Princess Leia during the awards ceremony after the Battle of Yavin. A powerful artifact in the Alderaanian royal family for dozens of generations.

front.title: •Orn Free Taa
front.gametext: Agendas: taxation, wealth. While in a senate majority, once per turn may take your just drawn battle destiny into hand. During opponent's deploy phase, may use X Force to place Taa in your Used Pile. (X = cards in opponent's Force Pile.)
front.lore: Obese Rutian Twi'lek senator. Once a tax collector, he has used his connections and political power to fuel a myriad of devious plots for whomever can make him the highest offer.

canceledBy: Game text is canceled by Freon Drevan

front.title: •Ortugg
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Functions as a leader if present with another Gamorrean. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Gamorreans are forfeit +2.
front.lore: Gamorrean in charge of the Gamorreans at Jabba's palace. Posted to stand guard at the entrance cavern. Assigned by Jabba to keep an eye on Tessek.

front.title: •Ortugg (V)
front.gametext: While at a Jabba's Palace site, your other Gamorreans are deploy -1 and forfeit +3. Permanent weapon is •Ortugg's Ax (may target a character or creature for free; draw destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if destiny +1 > defense value).
front.lore: Gamorrean in charge of the Gamorreans at Jabba's palace. Posted to stand guard at the entrance cavern. Assigned by Jabba to keep an eye on Tessek.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Phillip Gladney)

front.title: •OS-72-1 In Obsidian 1
front.gametext: Deploy -1 and power +3 at a cloud sector. Permanent pilot is •OS-72-1, who provides ability of 2, adds 2 to power and, at a cloud sector, may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Lead starfighter of Obsidian Squadron. Flown by Cive Rashon. Call sign 'Howlrunner.' She served in an elite TIE squadron aboard the Star Destroyer Avenger.

front.title: •OS-72-10
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if any TIE). When piloting a TIE at a cloud sector, adds one battle destiny and makes that TIE immune to attrition < 4 (< 6 if Obsidian 10).
front.lore: Pilot of Obsidian 10. Has served aboard the Conquest, the Thunderflare and the Executor. Not interested in advancing his rank as it would remove him from the pilot's seat.

front.title: •OS-72-2 In Obsidian 2
front.gametext: Deploy -1 and power +3 at a cloud sector. Permanent pilot is •OS-72-2, who provides ability of 2, adds 2 to power and, at a cloud sector, may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Piloted by Dodson Makraven, wingman of Cive Rashon. Experienced TIE pilot with many kills in atmospheric combat. Nicknamed 'Night Beast' for his many curfew violations.

front.title: •Our Blockade Is Perfectly Legal
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If no senator here, you may place a senator here from hand to add 3 to any battle destiny just drawn. If a blockade agenda here, during your turn you may cancel a 'react' or an attempt by opponent to move away from a battle.
front.lore: Until it could be proven otherwise, the Trade Federation maintained that they were pursuing a legal means of protesting the taxation of outlying trade routes.

cancels: An attempt by opponent to move away from a battle

front.title: Our First Catch Of The Day
front.gametext: Add 2 to a tractor beam destiny draw. OR Cancel The First Transport Is Away! or Hyper Escape.
front.lore: 'Sir, Rebel ships are coming into our sector.'

combo: Our First Catch Of The Day + Tractor Beam + In Range

front.title: Outer Rim Scout
front.gametext: Deploy -1 to your [Independent Starship] starship. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting a [Independent Starship] starship, instead adds 3 to power and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Suspends Asteroid Sanctuary at related sector.
front.lore: Smugglers and scouts employed by the ISB. Search the far reaches of the galaxy for Rebel activity and habitable worlds. Know all the smugglers' best hiding places.

front.title: •Outflank
front.gametext: During a battle, if you have weapons at at least 2 sites adjacent to that battle, add 3 to your total power and add one battle destiny. OR For remainder of turn, your biker scout at an exterior site is power +1 and adds 1 to each of that character's weapon destiny draws.
front.lore: Commander Igar's defense of Endor called for the use of speeder bikes to harass any attacking Rebels.

front.title: •Outflank (V)
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated battle at a site where their total power is greater than yours, you may use 1 Force (or cause opponent to use 1 Force) to relocate one of your characters or vehicles to that site from a related location.
front.lore: Commander Igar's defense of Endor called for the use of speeder bikes to harass any attacking Rebels.

front.title: Overload
front.gametext: Target any weapon (except a Gaderffii Stick or any Ewok weapon). Draw destiny. Weapon lost if destiny < weapon's destiny number. If destiny = 0, the character or starship carrying weapon is also lost.
front.lore: Weapons like lightsabers, turbolasers and blasters run on powerful energy cells or generators. Occasionally, these cells overheat causing the weapon to unexpectedly explode.

front.title: •Overseeing It Personally
front.gametext: Deploy on Emperor. While at a battleground planet site you control, at each related site where an Imperial is present, your Force drains are +1.
front.lore: Though reluctant to leave Coruscant. Emperor Palpatine occasionally finds it necessary to personally put lagging Imperial operations back on schedule.

pulledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points
combo: Overseeing It Personally + Emperor Palpatine or The Emperor

front.title: •Overseeing It Personally (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on your leader. Opponent may not cancel or reduce Force drains at same battleground. If on Emperor, may place Effect in Lost Pile to retrieve an Imperial leader.
front.lore: Though reluctant to leave Coruscant. Emperor Palpatine occasionally finds it necessary to personally put lagging Imperial operations back on schedule.

pulledBy: You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points
combo: Overseeing It Personally + Emperor Palpatine or The Emperor

front.title: Overwhelmed
front.gametext: During your deploy phase, target a system where your total power is more than double opponent's total power and opponent has no Jedi or starship weapon. Place all opponent's starships there (and cards on them) in owner's Used Pile.
front.lore: When the Empire amasses its fleet, the only option for the Alliance is retreat.

front.title: •OWO-1 With Backup
front.gametext: Requires +2 Force to use Landspeed. Power +1 for each opponent's Jedi present. While with a battledroid at a site, draws two battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Opponent's Force drains are -1 at adjacent sites.
front.lore: Trade Federation battle droid leader assigned to take a squad and destroy what was left of the Jedi ambassadors. His mission went unaccomplished.

combo: OWO-1 With Backup + Daultay Dofine

front.title: •P-13 & •P-14
front.gametext: May move as a 'react'. Permanent weapon is Twin Cannon (may target a character or vehicle for free; draw destiny; if destiny +1 > defense value, target hit (opponent loses 1 Force); may lose 2 Force to fire once more in battle). Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Shields protect destroyer droids from incoming or deflected blaster fire. Starfighter cannons, on the other hand, can cause some problems.

front.title: •P-59
front.gametext: Permanent weapon is Twin Cannons (may target a character or vehicle for free; draw destiny; if destiny +1 > defense value, target hit and opponent loses 2 Force). Draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Trade Federation destroyer droid squad leader. Charged with removing the threat posed by Qui-Gon Jinn and Obi-Wan Kenobi. Found the Jedi hard to kill, but forced their retreat.

combo: P-59 + Daultay Dofine

front.title: •P-60
front.gametext: Permanent weapon is Twin Cannons (may target a character or vehicle for free; draw destiny; if destiny +2 > defense value, target hit and opponent loses 1 Force). While with a destroyer droid at a site, adds one battle destiny.
