cancels: Any result of Krayt Dragon Bones when on Tatooine

front.title: •TC-14
front.gametext: Opponent's Jedi using landspeed from here require +2 Force. During any control phase may place TC-14 out of play to target one opponent's Jedi present. Target Jedi loses all immunity to attrition and is power = 0 for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Trade Federation-owned protocol droid used by the Neimoidians to distract the Jedi until a plan could be conceived to deal with them.

combo: TC-14 + 4-LOM With Concussion Rifle
TC-14 + E Chu Ta Cancel game text of an opponent's character present without sacrificing TC-14.
TC-14 + Oh, Switch Off

front.title: •T'doshok Hunting Vow
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Where you have two non-unique aliens present, draw one battle destiny if unable to otherwise and opponent's total power is -3. While Bossk at a site, (except Audience Chamber), Trandoshans are power +1 and forfeit +2.  May deploy non-[Virtual Block 6] Molator from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Rek guza kias n'ek kriesuk zief. Rek res fesruk T'doshok kulesuk luk g'razzurg koref selukra fes k'nel. Kren'ef, T'doshok res luk rek grien forek res fel luraken.

front.title: •Tech Mo'r
front.gametext: After using Ommni Box, peek at top X cards of pile or deck just shuffled, where X = number of other musicians at same site. May reshuffle without peeking.
front.lore: Male Bith musician. Plays Ommni Box in Figrin D'an's band. Lost ownership of instrument to Figrin while gambling.

front.title: •Teemto Pagalies' Podracer
front.gametext: Deploy on Podrace Arena. Adds 2 to each of your race destinies here. Once during each of your turns, may use 1 Force to place a race destiny here (random selection) in owner's Used Pile, draw one race destiny and place it here.
front.lore: IPG-X1131 Longtail Podracer. Unusual circular shape is designed around an internal metal cycling ring which stabilizes the non-aerodynamic vehicle.

front.title: •Televan Koreyy
front.gametext: Beggar and Frozen Assets are canceled. Your thieves, gamblers, and information brokers at related Tatooine sites are power +1. While at Cantina, Mos Espa, or Marketplace, may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Leader of Tatooine's Street Performers And Panhandlers' Guild. Televan can survive on almost nothing, and he keeps tight controls on other Guild members. Information broker.

front.title: •Tempest 1
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 8 passengers. Immune to attrition < 4. Landspeed may not be increased. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Each of its weapon destiny draws is +1.
front.lore: Command vehicle for Commander Igar. Uses an adapted TIE targeting system to combat maneuverable T-47s. Utilized in the subjugation of Kashyyyk. Enclosed.

combo: Tempest 1 + Trample

front.title: Tempest Scout
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. May move as a 'react' for 1 additional Force. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Your Elite Squadron stormtroopers are deploy -1 to same site.
front.lore: Manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards under the close supervision of the Empire. Often used in conjunction with AT-ATs in an anti-personnel role. Enclosed.

combo: Tempest Scout + Trample

front.title: •Tempest Scout 1
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. May move as a 'react' for free. When Arnet piloting, immune to attrition < 4 and adds 1 to attrition against opponent here.
front.lore: Enclosed AT-ST assigned as first response to incidents at Endor control bunker. Piloted by Lieutenant Arnet.

combo: Tempest Scout 1 (piloted) + Trample

front.title: •Tempest Scout 2
front.gametext: Deploy -1 to Endor. May add 2 pilots or passengers. May move as a 'react'. Immune to attrition < 3 when Marquand piloting. Your scouts may move here as a 'react'.
front.lore: Assigned to coordinate battle activities with the Endor biker scout detachment. Enclosed. First saw battle in Kashyyyk forests.

combo: Tempest Scout 2 + Lt. Watts + Major Marquand Power 8, draws two battle destiny, +2 to weapon destiny of vehicle weapon aboard, immune to attrition < 6 and can move as a react.
Tempest Scout 2 (piloted) + Trample

front.title: •Tempest Scout 3
front.gametext: May deploy or move as a 'react' to a forest or Endor site. May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.
front.lore: Enclosed. Assigned to the task of searching for potential Rebel traps. Modified to help cover more territory to accomplish this task.

combo: Tempest Scout 3 + Trample

front.title: •Tempest Scout 3 (V)
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. May move as a 'react.' Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Unless this vehicle 'hit,' your other vehicles here may not be targeted by non-character weapons or opponent's Interrupts.
front.lore: Enclosed. Assigned to the task of searching for potential Rebel traps. Modified to help cover more territory to accomplish this task.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Ryan Jellison)

front.title: •Tempest Scout 4
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. AT-ST Dual Cannon deploys free aboard and may target at an adjacent site.
front.lore: Enclosed vehicle. Equipped with a prototype targeting computer. Maintains accuracy even in dense foliage. Energy diverted from propulsion to weapons systems.

combo: Tempest Scout 4 + AT-ST Dual Cannon + Imperial Gunner Enclosed vehicle with a free deploying, repeat firing +2 weapon that can shoot from an adjacent site.
Tempest Scout 4 + Trample

front.title: •Tempest Scout 5
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. May move as a 'react'. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Adds 1 to your total power in battle at same site for each of your other piloted combat vehicles present.
front.lore: Uses experimental command and control software to coordinate combat data. Enclosed.

combo: Tempest Scout 5 + Trample

front.title: •Tempest Scout 6
front.gametext: May deploy -2 as a 'react'. May move as a 'react' for free. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 2.
front.lore: Enclosed. Modified for perimeter patrol. Elite crew trained for many months over heavily forested terrain.

combo: Tempest Scout 6 + Trample

front.title: Tentacle
front.gametext: If opponent just played an Interrupt, use 1 Force to deploy on table. That Interrupt is played out but is then 'grabbed' (played here but is out of play). Any new Interrupts of the same name are unique (•). (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: Dianogas use their seven tentacles for both locomotion and catching food. The few survivors of such attacks claim that a dianoga tentacle has the strength of a hydro-clamp.

front.title: Tentacle (V)
front.gametext: If opponent just played an Interrupt, unless three Tentacles on table, use 1 Force to deploy on table and stack that Interrupt here. Other copies of stacked Interrupt are destiny -3. (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: Dianogas use their seven tentacles for both locomotion and catching food. The few survivors of such attacks claim that a dianoga tentacle has the strength of a hydro-clamp.

front.title: •Tey How
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything she pilots. While aboard a battleship, whenever you must lose Force from a Force drain at a system within 2 parsecs of How, may use X Force to reduce the loss by X.
front.lore: Neimoidian Trade Federation communications officer to Nute Gunray. Had audio and visual mechanics surgically implanted to assist her in shipboard operations.

front.title: •That Thing's Operational
front.gametext: Deploy on Reactor Core. Death Star II may move (hyperspeed = 3). While Death Star II orbits a system you occupy (except Endor), once during each of your control phases, opponent loses X Force, where X = 2 plus number of related battleground sites you occupy. Once during each of opponent's control phases, opponent's piloted starfighter here may attempt to 'blow away' Death Star II. Draw destiny. Add 3 if armed with torpedoes or missiles. Add pilot's ability. If total destiny > 8, starships here may attempt to 'escape' and Death Star II is 'blown away' (lose double Force).

front.title: That's It, The Rebels Are There!
front.gametext: If you have a probe droid at a site during your control phase, move one of your starships to the related system. That starship cannot move again this turn.
front.lore: 'That is the system and I'm sure Skywalker is with them.'

front.title: The Circle Is Now Complete
front.gametext: If Vader and Obi-Wan are present at same site, use 1 Force to initiate a duel between them.  Compare their power, and add 2 if that character is armed with a lightsaber.  Loser (lowest total) of duel is placed out of play.
front.lore: Vader and Obi-Wan Kenobi fought a final lightsaber duel near Hangar Bay 327 on the Death Star. 'When I left you I was but the learner; now I am the master.'

combo: The Circle Is Now Complete + Lord Vader + any lightsaber No destiny draw, bye-bye any power 6 Obi Wan (Team Stephenville favorite) (Lord Helmet)

front.title: The Dark Path
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Once per turn, you may peek at the top three cards of your Reserve Deck. Place any two of those three in your Lost Pile.
front.lore: 'If once you start down the dark path, forever will it dominate your destiny. Consume you it will, as it did Obi- Wan's apprentice.'

front.title: The Dark Path (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. During battle, if you just drew a destiny, may lose that card to cancel and redraw that destiny. When you draw battle destiny, may lose X Force (limit 3) to make attrition against opponent +X.
front.lore: 'If once you start down the dark path, forever will it dominate your destiny. Consume you it will, as it did Obi-Wan's apprentice.'

front.title: The Dark Path (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Add one [Dark Side Force] icon at each site where you have a 'Hatred' card. Once per game, target two battleground sites you occupy; one at a time, stack top card of your Lost Pile face down (as a 'Hatred' card) at those locations. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'If once you start down the dark path, forever will it dominate your destiny. Consume you it will, as it did Obi- Wan's apprentice.'

front.title: •The Deflector Shield Is Too Strong
front.gametext: Landed starfighters and vehicles aboard starships are forfeit = 0. Once during your control phase may target your droid starfighter and opponent's starfighter present at same system. Both players draw destiny. You add your starfighter's power and maneuver. Opponent adds starfighter's power. Starship with lowest total is lost.

front.title: •The Ebb Of Battle
front.gametext: Activate 1 Force. OR Add 1 to your just-drawn duel destiny. OR If under your Dark Jedi as one of that character's combat cards, reveal to opponent and place in your Lost Pile to cancel an opponent's Force drain.
front.lore: Lightsaber confrontations are a complex dance of feints, strikes, parries and footwork. Mistakes are rarely forgiven.

front.title: •The Emperor
front.gametext: Deploys only to Coruscant or Death Star II. Never moves to a site occupied by opponent (even if carried). If Vader or Xizor here, and Luke is not on table, adds 2 to attrition against opponent at other locations. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Leader. Secretive manipulator of the galaxy. Played Darth Vader and Prince Xizor off against one another in his relentless pursuit of 'young Skywalker'.

combo: The Emperor + I Have You Now Add one battle destiny (two if Rebel is Luke) if a Dark Jedi and a Rebel with ability > 2 are involved in the same battle.
The Emperor + Force Field Cancels an attempt to target a Dark Jedi with a character weapon.
The Emperor + Janus Greejatus
The Emperor + Overseeing It Personally

front.title: •The Emperor (V)
front.gametext: Never deploys or moves (even if carried) to a non-Senate site opponent occupies. Each turn, may lose 1 Force (free in battle) to target a character present with him. Draw destiny. Target lost if destiny +1 > defense value. Gains [Republic] at opponent's Senate.
front.lore: Leader. Secretive manipulator of the galaxy. Played Darth Vader and Prince Xizor off against one another in his relentless pursuit of 'young Skywalker'.

front.title: •The Emperor Is Coming Here?
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Once per game, if Emperor on table, may deploy a Royal Guard from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  You may play Force Lightning as follows: 'USED: During battle, target a character present with Emperor.  Draw destiny.  If destiny +3 > ability, target loses immunity to attrition and is power -2.' (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Though reluctant to leave Coruscant, Emperor Palpatine occasionally finds it necessary to personally put lagging Imperial operations back on schedule.

front.title: •The Emperor's Prize
front.gametext: If Luke was just 'frozen,' deploy on Emperor or Detention Block Corridor. Target Luke and Vader. When reached by targets, place Utinni Effect on Luke and opponent must lose Force from Life Force equal to half their Life Force (round down). If Luke released, lose Utinni Effect. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Vader thought that by capturing Luke, he would crush the Alliance's last hope. But, there was another...

combo: The Emperor's Prize + Vader's Bounty Not only do you deal massive amounts of damage, but you also retrieve a hefty amount of Force as well. As long as Vader is nearby, which he should be if you want to keep Luke unharmed, you can regain a lot of the loss that you'll take in setting up this combination.

front.title: •The Emperor's Prize (V)
front.gametext: Unless your [Death Star II] Objective on table, deploy on Vader. Target Luke (even at Dagobah). During opponent's move phase, if Vader present at a battleground site, opponent loses 1 Force. Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target.
front.lore: Vader thought that by capturing Luke, he would crush the Alliance's last hope. But, there was another...

front.title: •The Emperor's Shield
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Endor, Death Star II or same location as Thrawn. May deploy as a 'react'. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3. Power +3 at Endor or when Emperor is at same or related location.
front.lore: Top outer rim pilots hand picked by Admiral Thrawn. Sent to protect the Emperor during his inspection of the second Death Star.

front.title: •The Emperor's Sword
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to Coruscant or Death Star II. May deploy as a 'react'. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3. Power +3 at Coruscant or when Emperor is at same or related location.
front.lore: Eliete pilots sworn to defend the Emperor to the death. Assigned older TIEs due to their years of experience with them. Stationed at Coruscant but always travel with the Emperor.

front.title: The Empire's Back
front.gametext: If Vader, Tarkin, Motti or Tagge is lost, use 2 Force to retrieve one of them from the Lost Pile. OR Use 4 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take Vader, Tarkin, Motti, or Tagge into your hand. Shuffle deck, cut and replace.
front.lore: 'No star system will dare oppose the Emperor now.'

front.title: The Empire's Back (V)
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy (or retrieve) Motti, Tagge, Tarkin, or Vader from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Once during your control phase, for each battleground controlled by Motti, Tagge, Tarkin, or Vader, opponent loses 1 Force.
front.lore: 'No star system will dare oppose the Emperor now.'

front.title: •The Force Unleashed
front.gametext: Deploy on table. During battle, you may play Lightsaber Parry, Tarkin's Orders, and There Is No Conflict as follows: 'If Vader or Galen present: USED: Target a vehicle or starship present. Draw destiny. If destiny > 2, target 'thrown' (hit and adds its printed defense value to your total power). LOST: Target opponent's character present and choose (then draw destiny): If destiny > ability, target 'choked' (lost). OR If destiny +1 > ability, target 'drained of life' (hit and opponent loses 2 Force).'

front.title: •The Grand Inquisitor
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. If a Jedi or Padawan just lost from same site as any Inquisitor, opponent loses 1 Force. If a Jedi or Padawan just moved from here, Inquisitors present may follow that character (using landspeed). Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Pau'an leader.

front.title: •The Hutts Are Gangsters
front.gametext: Deploy on table. While Amidala with Jabba, her game text is canceled. While you occupy an [Episode I] Tatooine site with [Episode I] Jabba, once per turn you may place a card from hand in your Used Pile to draw a card from Reserve Deck. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'If they discovered her...'

cancels: Game text of Amidala when present with Jabba

front.title: •The Inner Circle
front.gametext: Deploy on Conference Room (only at start of game); deploy Sim Aloo here and (Virtual Block 4) There is No Try from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Players may initiate battle here for free. Once per game may deploy Ord Mantell from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. May not be canceled (except by opponent) or placed in Used Pile. Immune to Ineffective Maneuver.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •The Modal Nodes' Ommni Box
front.gametext: Deploy on Tech Mo'r or use 2 Force to deploy on your musician (or a site). Your musicians here not carrying this device are Heroic. 'At same site' on your musicians may be treated as 'at battleground sites.' 'Cover charges' only apply to your opponent but are limited to 3.
front.lore: Difficult-to-play instrument which enhances music. Tech Mo'r plays one for Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes in the Mos Eisley Cantina.

front.title: •The Phantom Menace
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per turn, if Maul on table, may deploy a Neimoidian from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While present with opponent's Jedi, Maul is defense value +2 and immune to attrition. If Maul just lost, place Effect in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Mysterious hologram that communicates with the Trade Federation, directing their blockade of Naboo. 'This is getting out of hand. Now there are two of them!'

front.title: •The Phantom Menace (AI)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per turn, if Maul on table, may deploy a Neimoidian from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While present with opponent's Jedi, Maul is defense value +2 and immune to attrition. If Maul just lost, place Effect in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Mysterious hologram that communicates with the Trade Federation, directing their blockade of Naboo. 'This is getting out of hand. Now there are two of them!'

front.title: •The Point Is Conceded
front.gametext: If you have a senate majority, activate 1 Force. OR If your opponent has a senate majority, place your senator at Galactic Senate in Used Pile to place an opponent's character present (your choice) in opponent's Used Pile. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: Political pressure carefully applied with a generous helping of Republic procedure can negate the strongest of motions.

front.title: •The Quick And Easy Path
front.gametext: Deploy on table.  Sith Fury and your non-epic duels are canceled.  Once per turn, may use 1 Force to take a non-[Episode I] Interrupt (or Immediate Effect) with 'duel' in its game text into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  If [Virtual Block 6] Epic Duel on table, Force retrieved (or lost) during a duel cannot be reduced or canceled. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Ready are you? What know you of ready?'

front.title: The Shield Doors Must Be Closed
front.gametext: Deploy between Echo Docking Bay and innermost marker site. When under 'nighttime conditions,' no movement is allowed to or from Echo Docking Bay unless it is to or from an Echo site.
front.lore: 'Your highness, there's nothing more we can do tonight. The shield doors must be closed.'

front.title: •There Is No Conflict
front.gametext: USED: If your Imperial of ability > 2 just won a battle, randomly take into hand one card stacked on I Can Feel The Conflict. (Immune to Sense.)  LOST: If Vader in battle, subtract 2 from each of opponent's battle destiny draws.
front.lore: 'That name no longer has any meaning.'

front.title: •There Is No Try
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Sense and Alter are now Lost Interrupts. Also, when any player makes a destiny draw for Sense or Alter, and that destiny draw is successful, that player loses 2 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Always with you what cannot be done.'

front.title: •There Is No Try
front.gametext: Plays on table. Sense and Alter are now Lost Interrupts. When any player makes a destiny draw for Sense or Alter, and that destiny draw is successful, that player loses 2 Force.
front.lore: 'Always with you what cannot be done.'

cards.counterpart: Do, Or Do Not - Defensive Shield

front.title: •There Is No Try & •Oppressive Enforcement
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Sense and Alter are now Lost Interrupts. When any player makes a destiny draw for Sense or Alter, and that destiny draw is successful, that player loses 2 Force. Your Immediate Effects may deploy for free. Whenever opponent cancels your card with Sense or Alter, place that canceled card in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)

front.title: •There Is No Try & •Oppressive Enforcement (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Conference Room.  Revolution is canceled.  You may not deploy aliens (except bounty hunters and Mara Jade) or [Episode I] cards.  Emperor and your admirals, generals, and moffs are Imperial Council Members and influence +1.  While present here, each Imperial Council Member adds one [Dark Side Force].  Once per turn, may use 1 Force to deploy one Laser Gate or a Political Effect from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Your cards may deploy to table from Political Effects.  May place your canceled Political Effect in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)

front.title: •There They Are!
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated, your non-unique battle droids are each power +1 for remainder of battle. (Immune to Sense if battle at a Naboo site.) OR Take a non-unique battle droid or non-unique droid starfighter into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: When unexplained droid losses are detected, a Droid Control Ship can call in reinforcements in seconds.

front.title: •••There'll Be Hell To Pay
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on table and stack one just-played Interrupt here. To play any new Interrupt of the same name, player must first stack it here and use +1 Force for each Interrupt in stack, even if Interrupt is normally free. (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: Luke's dream of joining the Academy often distracted him from his chores, sometimes resulting in his having to pay the price for his impatience.

cards.counterpart: What're You Tryin' To Push On Us?

front.title: •Thermal Detonator
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on any bounty hunter. When collecting a bounty, adds 3 to Force retrieved. Also, may 'detonate' at same site. Draw 3 destiny. All cards (except Effects) with any of those destiny numbers at that site are lost. Thermal Detonator also lost.
front.lore: Strictly regulated. Dangerously unstable. Explosive baradium core. Class-A type has blast radius of 20 meters. Can be programmed with a very sensitive deadman's switch.

front.title: •They Must Never Again Leave This City
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Opponent's movement from a Bespin location to a non-Bespin location requires +1 Force. Once per game, Executor deploys for free to Bespin system. Once per turn, may take into hand a TIE just forfeited from a Bespin location.
front.lore: Vader's plans were to turn the city in the clouds into a graveyard for the Rebellion.

front.title: •They Will Be No Match For You
front.gametext: Deploy on table. When Maul initiates a duel, Hunt Down And Destroy The Jedi (or Their Fire Has Gone Out Of The Universe) is not placed out of play. While armed with a lightsaber, Maul's duel destiny draws are each +1. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'At last we will reveal ourselves to the Jedi.'

front.title: •They Will Be No Match For You (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per turn, may deploy Maul's Lightsaber from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. At start of opponent's control phase, may relocate Maul to same site as a Jedi. May place this Effect out of play to deploy Maul's Lightsaber from Lost Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'At last we will reveal ourselves to the Jedi.'

front.title: •They're Coming In Too Fast!
front.gametext: If you have a piloted starship armed with a starship weapon, select one opponent's starship present to lose all immunity to attrition for remainder of turn. OR Cancel A Few Maneuvers.
front.lore: 'We're not out of this yet!'

front.title: They're Still Coming Through!
front.gametext: Cancel Rebel Barrier, It's A Trap!, or Smoke Screen. OR Re-target Fallen Portal by choosing up to two of opponent's characters there instead of your own. OR Peek at the top card of your Force Pile; either return it, or place it under your Force Pile or Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Despite the barriers erected, sometimes a determined opponent cannot be kept out.

front.title: •They've Shut Down The Main Reactor
front.gametext: If you have a piloted capital starship armed with a starship weapon or equipped with a tractor beam, use 2 Force to target an opponent's starship present. Until end of your next turn, target cannot move and its pilots may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny.
front.lore: 'We'll be destroyed for sure!'

front.title: This Deal Is Getting Worse All The Time / Pray I Don't Alter It Any Further
front.gametext: This Deal Is Getting Worse All The Time:Deploy one Cloud City battleground site. May deploy Secret Plans and/or All Wrapped Up.{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may take Bespin system, Bespin: Cloud City, Dark Deal or Cloud City Occupation into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your [Cloud City], [Jabba's Palace] and [Special Edition] characters are immune to Goo Nee Tay when deploying to Bespin Locations.{Flip} this card if Dark Deal on table and you occupy Bespin System and Bespin: Cloud City.Pray I Don't Alter It Any Further:{While} this side up, Surreptitious Glance may not cancel Dark Deal, The Planet That It's Farthest From is suspended if targeting Bespin. Opponent loses 8 Force when you play All Too Easy. At each Bespin location you control with an Imperial, your Force drains may not be modified by opponent. If you have an alien/imperial pair in battle, your total battle destiny is +2 (+4 if alien is an Ugnaught).{Flip} this card if Dark Deal is canceled, if opponent controls Bespin or if Bespin is 'blown away'.

back.title: This Deal Is Getting Worse All The Time / Pray I Don't Alter It Any Further
back.gametext: This Deal Is Getting Worse All The Time:Deploy one Cloud City battleground site. May deploy Secret Plans and/or All Wrapped Up.{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may take Bespin system, Bespin: Cloud City, Dark Deal or Cloud City Occupation into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your [Cloud City], [Jabba's Palace] and [Special Edition] characters are immune to Goo Nee Tay when deploying to Bespin Locations.{Flip} this card if Dark Deal on table and you occupy Bespin System and Bespin: Cloud City.Pray I Don't Alter It Any Further:{While} this side up, Surreptitious Glance may not cancel Dark Deal, The Planet That It's Farthest From is suspended if targeting Bespin. Opponent loses 8 Force when you play All Too Easy. At each Bespin location you control with an Imperial, your Force drains may not be modified by opponent. If you have an alien/imperial pair in battle, your total battle destiny is +2 (+4 if alien is an Ugnaught).{Flip} this card if Dark Deal is canceled, if opponent controls Bespin or if Bespin is 'blown away'.

front.title: •This Is Just Wrong
front.gametext: Deploy on any male character. Target a female character on table. Target is power -2. Utinni Effect canceled when present with target.
front.lore: 'Why, I guess you don't know everything about women yet.'

front.title: •This Is Not Good
front.gametext: USED: For remainder of turn, subtract 2 from any attempt to 'blow away' Blockade Flagship.  LOST: During any deploy phase, use 3 Force to target any starship at same system as your battleship. Target is hyperspeed = 0 until end of turn.
front.lore: 'Everything's overheated.'

front.title: •This Is Outrageous!
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If no senator here, you may place a senator here from hand to cancel an opponent's Force drain. If a trade agenda here, once during your turn, you may place a card from hand in Lost Pile, shuffle that pile, and take top card into hand.
front.lore: 'I recommend a commission be sent to Naboo to ascertain the truth!'

front.title: This Is Some Rescue!
front.gametext: Cancel I'm Here To Rescue You, Plastoid Armor, Out Of Commission, Alternatives To Fighting, Cell 2187 or Ewok Rescue.
front.lore: 'When you came in here, didn't you have a plan for getting out?'

front.title: •This Is Still Wrong
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated where opponent has a female targeted by This Is Just Wrong, add one battle destiny. OR Search your Reserve Deck, take one This Is Just Wrong into hand and reshuffle. OR Cancel This Is More Like It.
front.lore: Han: 2. Luke: 2. Chewie: 0.

front.title: •Thok & Thug
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to a Jabba's Palace site.  If opponent just initiated battle at same site, may use X Force (limit 2) to add twice X to power. Your alien leaders present may not be targeted by weapons. End of your turn: Use 2 Force to maintain OR Lose 1 Force to place in Used Pile OR Place out of play.
front.lore: Jabba the Hutt knew that having a big, strong, dumb guard was good, but having lots of them is better.

front.title: •Thok & Thug (V)
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Jabba's Palace sites. While with your alien leader, Heroic. Once per turn, if defending a battle, may use 1 Force to add 2 to your total power.
front.lore: Jabba the Hutt knew that having a big, strong, dumb guard was good, but having lots of them is better.

front.title: Those Rebels Won't Escape Us
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Nabrun Leids.  LOST: During your move phase, cancel Landing Claw. OR Cancel Hyper Escape, Closer?! or one 'react.'
front.lore: 'I don't know how we're gonna get out of this one.'

front.title: Those Rebels Won't Escape Us (V)
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to take Stinger or Virago into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Cancel Darklighter Spin. OR If opponent just initiated a battle at same system or sector as Stinger or Virago, opponent may not target those starfighters with weapons for remainder of turn.
front.lore: 'I don't know how we're gonna get out of this one.'

front.title: •Thrawn's Ysalami
front.gametext: Habitat: sites. Parasite: Imperials. While attached and present, at same site: all Force generation is canceled, Dark Jedi and Jedi are defense value -1 and their weapon destinies are -1, and no attacks.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Jeffrey Johns - PC Volunteer Award 2007)

front.title: •Through The Corridor
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated battle against Maul where opponent has two Jedi, cancel that battle and you may relocate one of those Jedi (your choice) to any adjacent site. That Jedi may not move for remainder of turn. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: Obi-Wan was anxious, Qui-Gon was patient, and Maul was angry.

front.title: •Thul Fain
front.gametext: Deploys free to your [Independent Starship] starship. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When with Lieutenant Tanbris in a battle at a system, adds 2 to each of your battle destiny draws.
front.lore: Gambler who bets on how long the Rancor's victims will last. Formerly an Imperial pilot who worked with Lieutenant Tanbris. Now a smuggler for Jabba.

front.title: •Thunderflare
front.gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. Turbolaser Batteries deploy and fire free here.
front.lore: Overpowered Star Destroyer. Energy is transferred from hyperdrive to weapons. Patrol duties in the Core Worlds make it a common first assignment for junior officers.

combo: Thunderflare + Turbloaser Battery
Thunderflare + Heavy Turbloaser Battery
THunderflare + Imperial Helmsman Draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

front.title: •Tibanna Floating Refinery
front.gametext: Deploy on a cloud sector. Your Force generation is +1 at cloud sectors you occupy. Once during your control phase, if you occupy this sector and a battleground site, may draw destiny. If destiny > 2, retrieve 1 Force. If lost from table, place this Device in Used Pile.
front.lore: Refines Tibanna gas at mines like those at Cloud City. Also used for moisture collection on dry planets.

front.title: Tibanna Gas Miner
front.gametext: When at a site, adds 1 to your Force drains at related cloud sectors. Also, during your activate phase, if at a Cloud City site and you control Bespin: Cloud City, may cumulatively activate 1 Force for every cloud sector on Bespin.
front.lore: One of the many Cloud City miners who are willingly employed by greedy corporations exploiting planetary atmospheres. Unconcerned with environmental repercussions.

combo: Tibanna Gas Miner + Bespin: Cloud City Adds one to the Force drain at Bespin: Cloud City.

front.title: TIE Advanced x1
front.gametext: Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: TIE advanced x1 fighter boasting improved power plant, stronger shields, armored hull and enhanced weapons. Deployed to elite Imperial Navy pilots.

front.title: TIE Assault Squadron
front.gametext: * Replaces 3 TIE/lns at one location (TIE/lns go to Used Pile). Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3.
front.lore: Imperial strategy relies on quantity over quality. Although many of their pilots have low motivation, this is compensated by 'wolfpack' group tactics.

front.title: TIE Avenger
front.gametext: Deploy -1 to same system as any Imperial capital starship. May add 1 pilot. Boosted TIE Cannon may deploy aboard.
front.lore: Design based on Lord Vader's prototype Advanced x1. Manufactured until replaced by the more economical TIE Interceptor. Equipped with deflector shields and a hyperdrive.

front.title: TIE Avenger (V)
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech.  While TIE Fighter Construction Facility on table, pilot is forfeit +2 and this starship may not be lost before the damage segment of battle.  May deploy an astromech aboard from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Design based on Lord Vader's prototype Advanced x1. Manufactured until replaced by the more economical TIE Interceptor. Equipped with deflector shields and a hyperdrive.

front.title: TIE Bomber
front.gametext: Power +2 during a Bombing Run battle. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. At any time during your turn, may use 1 Force to 'diffuse' (lose or return to hand) any one Orbital Mine present.
front.lore: Because fleet orbital bombardment often destroyed entire cities, the double-pod TIE surface assault starfighter was developed to allow more precise and controlled targeting.

front.title: TIE Defender Mark I
front.gametext: May deploy as a `react'. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Any starship cannon may deploy aboard. Power - 2 while opponent has a starfighter present with higher maneuver.
front.lore: First production run of TIE defender design. Powerful P-sz9.7 sublight engines. Fire-linked laser cannons. Aft blind spot exploited by maneuverable enemy starfighters.

front.title: TIE Fighter
front.gametext: Deploy -1 to same system as any Imperial capital starship. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: TIE or Twin Ion Engine. TIE/ln model is Empire's most common fighter. Quick and maneuverable. Solar-panel wings supplement power generator. Built by Sienar Fleet Systems.

front.title: •TIE Fighter Construction Facility
front.gametext: Deploy on table. TIE/ads and restricted (•••) TIEs are deploy = 2, forfeit = 4, and immune to attrition < 4. Ignore 'unique (•)' in Watch Your Back's game text. Attrition against opponent is +3 where your capital starship present with a non-squadron TIE. (Immune to Alter.)

front.title: TIE Interceptor
front.gametext: Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Power +1 when present with an X-wing. During each battle, may fire one starship weapon aboard twice.
front.lore: Advanced TIE design. Assigned to elite squadrons, such as the 181st. Developed with enhanced weapons and maneuverability to defeat the Incom X-wing design.

front.title: TIE Scout
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 passenger, or 2 passengers. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: Limited production, light reconnaissance starship. Minimal armor and weapons. Long-range sensor and communications array. Scouts for Rebel activity.

combo: TIE Scout + I've Lost Artoo!!! Make room for a real astromech and still add a pilot and passenger.

front.title: •TIE Sentry Ships
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a Force drain at a system, cloud sector or asteroid sector, you may 'react' by deploying TIEs and pilots to that location (at normal use of the Force).
front.lore: Several TIEs were assigned to patrol Cloud City prior to the Imperial occupation of Bespin. Their instructions were to herd any vessels attempting to escape toward the Executor.

front.title: •TIE Sentry Ships (V)
front.gametext: USED: If you just drew a unique (•) Imperial starship for destiny, take that starship into hand to cancel and redraw the destiny.  LOST: Use 3 Force to retrieve a unique (•) Imperial starship into hand.
front.lore: Several TIEs were assigned to patrol Cloud City prior to the Imperial occupation of Bespin. Their instructions were to herd any vessels attempting to escape toward the Executor.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Michael Erisman - PC Volunteer Award 2008)

front.title: •TIE Sentry Ships (V)
front.gametext: USED: If you just drew a starship for destiny, take that starship into hand to cancel and redraw that destiny.  LOST: Use 3 Force to retrieve a starship into hand.
front.lore: Several TIEs were assigned to patrol Cloud City prior to the Imperial occupation of Bespin. Their instructions were to herd any vessels attempting to escape toward the Executor.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Michael Erisman - PC Volunteer Award 2008)

front.title: TIE Vanguard
front.gametext: Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. You may deploy cards to same system or sector as a 'react'.
front.lore: Reconnaissance starfighter. Often deployed first to gather detailed information on enemy starship movement before full fleet engagement.

front.title: •Tikkes
front.gametext: Agenda: wealth. While in a senate majority, your Force generation is +2 at battlegrounds you control, and Honor Of The Jedi is suspended. Once during your deploy phase, may draw bottom card of your Force Pile into hand.
front.lore: Quarren senator elected by the people of Mon Calamari. Has amassed considerable wealth through a multitude of political deals, but still moves to gain more.

cancels: Suspends Honor Of The Jedi while in a senate majority

front.title: Timer Mine
front.gametext: Deploy on opponent's side at same site as one of your mining droids. 'Explodes' at beginning of your next turn. Draw destiny. That number of opponent's characters there are immediately lost (owner's choice). Timer Mine is also lost.
front.lore: A timer-activated explosive device designed to be placed by a mining droid. Originally used in ore and spice mines for demolition. Altered for military use.

front.title: •Tonnika Sisters
front.gametext: Twice during each of your control phases, may use 2 Force to draw 2 destiny for 2 chances at a destiny = 2. If successful, may steal or destroy up to 2 weapons or 2 devices present.
front.lore: Twins. Thieves. Con artists. Spies. Swindlers. Double agents. Brea and Senni use their natural charm to sway the unwary on the fringe of society.

combo: Tonnika Sisters + Kiffex
Tonnika Sisters + Nevar Yalnal
canceledBy: If Vul Tazaene present with Tonnika Sisters
Vul and Tonnika Sisters are lost

front.title: Too Cold For Speeders
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your side of table. Non-creature vehicles at marker sites under 'nighttime conditions' are power = 0, maneuver = 0 and landspeed = 0.
front.lore: 'We're having some trouble adapting them to the cold.'

front.title: •Toonbuck Toora
front.gametext: Agendas: ambition, taxation, wealth. While in a senate majority, once per turn may add 1 to your total attrition in battle for each character with an ambition agenda at Galactic Senate.
front.lore: Female senator and member of her planet's ruling class. Her original optimism in the political process has been eroded by witnessing bribery, corruption and petty bickering.

front.title: •Toonbuck Toora (V)
front.gametext: While at Separatist Council Room, Jar Jar may not deploy here and opponent's non-[Immune to Alter] Efefcts deployed on that site are suspended.
front.lore: Female senator and member of her planet's ruling class. Her original optimism in the political process has been eroded by witnessing bribery, corruption and petty bickering.

front.title: •Torture
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Never Tell Me The Odds if it was just inserted or revealed. (Immune to Sense).  LOST: Target a droid at Droid Workshop that you have captured or stolen. Droid is lost. Retrieve Force equal to droid's forfeit (doubled if stolen).
front.lore: 'We have been without an interpreter since our master got angry with our last protocol droid and disintegrated him.'

front.title: Tractor Beam
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Star Destroyer. At the end of a battle at same system or sector, may target an opponent's starship present (except Mon Calamari Star Cruiser) using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target captured if destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Captures enemy vessels for boarding. When used in conjunction with an ion cannon, tractor beams can ensnare even the most maneuverable starships.

combo: Tractor Beam + In Range + Our First Catch Of The Day
Tractor Beam + Captain Lennox + Besieged
Tractor Beam + Flawless Marksmanship
Tractor Beam + I Want That Ship
Tractor Beam + Ion Cannon

front.title: Trade Federation Battleship
front.gametext: May add 4 pilots, 4 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. While with any starfighter, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
front.lore: Massive cargo vessels that were converted by the Trade Federation into armed battleships. Each is equipped with a large contingent of droid starfighters and battle droids.

combo: Trade Federation Battleship + Naboo + Neimoidian Pilots Neimoidian Pilots deploy free and activate 1 Force each time they deploy. How often do you have more active Force after your deploy phase than before?

Trade Federation Battleship + Droid Starfighters + Battle Deployment Each player's ships are power -2 at systems where he doesn't have both a capital ship and a starfighter. Since Trade Federation Battleships and Droid Starfighters are meant to go together, you already have that covered. Does your opponent?
Trade Federation Battleship + Sil Unch

front.title: <>Trade Federation Droid Control Ship
front.gametext: May add 4 pilots, 4 passengers, 2 vehicles, and 4 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. While a droid starfighter here, adds one battle destiny.
front.lore: These heavily modifed battleships are used to control and direct the Trade Federation's automated army. Easily identified by its array of sensors and antennae.

combo: Federation Droid Control Ship + Neimodian Pilot + Tey How + Droid Starfighter Power 12 plus 2 battle destiny. Add a few more pilots and/or ships to maintain control of a system while Tey How reduces your Force loss to drains at systems within 2 parsecs.
Federation Droid Control Ship + Sil Unch

front.title: Trade Federation Landing Craft
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 6 vehicles. Deploys and moves like a starfighter. While at a site, once during your deploy phase may take an MTT into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: C-9979 landing craft designed to transport and unload Multi Troop Transports and its battle droid cargo as rapidly as possible.

front.title: •Trade Federation Tactics
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to target a starship at same system as your [Trade Federation] starship armed with a weapon. Target is forfeit = 0 until end of turn. OR During battle, add X to your total power, where X = armor of one of your [Trade Federation] starships in that battle.
front.lore: Organizations as wealthy as the Trade Federation can afford large amounts of military hardware, all purchased under the guise of protecting their commercial interests.

front.title: •Trade Federation Tactics (V)
front.gametext: Retarget an attempt to make your [Episode I] character 'hit' or lost to your other [Episode I] character present. OR Retarget opponent's just drawn destiny result about to make your starship 'hit' or lost to your character aboard; starship is protected from all such attempts this turn. OR deploy Sil Unch.
front.lore: Organizations as wealthy as the Trade Federation can afford large amounts of military hardware, all purchased under the guise of protecting their commercial interests.

front.title: •Trade Federation Tactics (V)
front.gametext: USED: Cancel an attempt to use a weapon to target your capital starship. LOST: Re-target On Target to an opponent's capital starship armed with a weapon. OR Take Blockade Support Ship or Invisible Hand into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Organizations as wealthy as the Trade Federation can afford large amounts of military hardware, all purchased under the guise of protecting their commercial interests.

front.title: •Trained In The Jedi Arts
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Your [Pemanent Weapon] and [Maintenance] cards are lost. 'Vader' on your Interrupts may be treated as 'Maul or Mara Jade.'  Wherever you have an Effect with 'skill' in its game text, your Force drains and battle destiny draws are +1. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: While Qui-Gon spent years maintaining peace, Maul was sharpening his combat skills. Those years of training came to fruition in one fateful moment.

front.title: Trample
front.gametext: If you have a piloted AT-AT or AT-ST present at a site, target opponent's character, 'crashed' vehicle or unpiloted vehicle without armor present. Draw destiny. Character lost if destiny > ability. Vehicle lost if destiny < 7.
front.lore: The enormous feet of a walker are designed for mobility on many types of terrain. They also can be used by merciless pilots to crush the Rebellion.

combo: Trample + any piloted AT-AT or AT-ST present at a site
Trample + Walker Garrison

front.title: Trandoshan
front.gametext: Power and Forfeit +1 at same site as a Wookiee or while Bossk at Audience Chamber. When in battle at same site as a bounty, adds 1 to attrition against opponent.
front.lore: Trandoshans refer to themselves as T'doshok. Hate Wookiees. Many have come to work for Jabba, attempting to emulate the success of Bossk.

front.title: •Trap Door
front.gametext: If you have no characters at Rancor Pit at the end of your deploy phase, target a character (even a captive) at Audience Chamber. Draw destiny. If destiny +2 > ability, target relocated to Rancor Pit, and, if captive, released to the Light Side of Rancor Pit (not Used Pile).
front.lore: 'Boscka!'

front.title: Trinto Duaba
front.gametext: If there are cards in the opponent's Used Pile during your battle phase, draw one destiny. All cards there with the same destiny number are lost.
front.lore: A Stennes Shifter, a near-human race. Have ability to blend unnoticed into crowds. Trinto profits from turning lawbreakers over to Imperial authorities.

combo: Trinto Duaba + Monnok
Trinto Duaba + Dune Sea Sabacc (or any Sabacc really) + Voyeur Play Sabacc to get cards in their used pile, then the other 2 Interrupts to make them lose force/other cards. (maxbeedo)

front.title: Trooper Assault
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated at a site, each of your troopers present is power +2 and immune to attrition for remainder of turn.
front.lore: An assault of stormtroopers caused Leia, Chewie and Lando to retreat. When working together, the troopers' powerful onslaught can appear unstoppable.

front.title: Trooper Charge
front.gametext: Select one of your troopers in a battle to make a 'charge.' If that trooper is a Death Star Trooper, it is power +3 this battle. If any other trooper, power +2. However, that trooper must be forfeited at end of battle.
front.lore: Imperial troopers are fearless and totally indoctrinated. Backed by the most powerful weapons and starships in the galaxy, they tend to consider themselves invincible.

front.title: •Trooper Davin Felth
front.gametext: While he is on Tatooine, Local Trouble and Look Sir, Droids are Used Interrupts. Opponent may select target when using Friendly Fire at same site as Felth.
front.lore: Dispatched to Tatooine to apprehend renegade droids fleeing the Tantive IV. Suspected to have misgivings about Imperial methods. Allegedly shot his commander in the back.

front.title: •Trooper Davin Felth (V)
front.gametext: During your control phase, may take (or lose 1 Force to retrieve) one Local Trouble or Look Sir, Droids into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Opponent may not fire weapons during Local Trouble battles.
front.lore: Dispatched to Tatooine to apprehend renegade droids fleeing the Tantive IV. Suspected to have misgivings about Imperial methods. Allegedly shot his commander in the back.

front.title: •Trooper Jerrol Blendin
front.gametext: Deploys only on Cloud City, but may move elsewhere. Power +2 when participating in a battle you initiate. Opponent may use 2 Force to 'bribe' (exclude) Blendin from battle.
front.lore: Corrupt captain of the Cloud City Wing Guard. Began working during the administration of Baron Raynor. Easily bribed. Keeps the peace through intimidation.

combo: Blendin + Trooper Assault + Trooper Charge : Power *8* if you initiate the battle, all at the cost of zero Force! Makes a great surprise for your opponent in a 'react' deck.  Blendin + Lone Warrior : Leave him alone at a site and give him defensive cards. Then, if your opponent chooses not to let him participate in a battle, the battle is just cancelled.

front.title: •Trooper Sabacc
front.gametext: Requirements: A gambler or trooper at a site. Wild cards (2-7): Imperial and Rebel leaders. (Troopers may use weapons as wildcards.) Clone cards: Locations and droids. Stakes: One transport vehicle without armor or one character weapon.
front.lore: Sabacc is a popular game for off-duty Imperial stormtroopers throughout the galaxy.

front.title: •Trophy Of A Bounty Hunter
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Whenever opponent's card hit by your bounty hunter leaves table, stack it here face down. Your bounty hunters are power and defense value +X, where X = number of cards stacked here. Once per game, may deploy Desilijic Tattoo or Jabba's Influence. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Abyssins are known for their regenerative abilities. Jabba keeps several statue heads of Abyssin creatures on his repulsor sled.

front.title: ••Trophy Of A Kill
front.gametext: Deploy on Galen, Grievous or your female of ability >3. Character is immunity to attrition +2 (and power +2 if female). May add 1 to Force drain where present. This device lost if character Disarmed.

front.title: •TT-6
front.gametext: May add 7 passengers. Once per turn, may deploy a battle droid leader to same site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 3 (< 5 if your AAT or STAP present).
front.lore: Primary command liaison transport. Contains the majority of officer battle droids. Has priority to unload as soon as the area is secured. Enclosed.

front.title: •TT-9
front.gametext: May add 4 passengers and 3 STAPs. Once per turn, may deploy a STAP to same site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 3 (< 5 if your AAT or STAP present).
front.lore: Auxiliary mobilization supply transport. Coordinates with the Droid Control Ship to determine whether additional STAPs are needed in any given area. Enclosed.

front.title: Turbolaser Battery
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on your Star Destroyer or any mobile system. May target a starship using 2 Force. Draw two destiny. Subtract 2 if targeting a capital starship. Otherwise, subtract 5. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: High-powered blasters. Require power generators, cryogenic cooling units and large crews. More effective against capital starships than starfighters.

combo: Turboaser Battery + Ion Cannon
Turbolaser Battery + Rendili StarDrive

front.title: Turn It Off! Turn It Off!
front.gametext: USED: Cancel any attempt to place a 'hit' starship, vehicle or droid in the Used Pile rather than the Lost Pile. OR Cancel Han's Toolkit.  LOST: Cancel Crash Site Memorial.
front.lore: 'Turn it off! Turn it off! Off! TURN IT OFF!'

cancels: Any attempt to place a 'hit' starship
vehicle or droid in the Used Pile rather than the Lost Pile

front.title: Turn It Off! Turn It Off! (V)
front.gametext: Play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect. OR If opponent just deployed a [Maintenance] card, it may not battle for remainder of turn. OR Cancel Out Of Commission (if attempting to place a card out of play). (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: 'Turn it off! Turn it off! Off! TURN IT OFF!'

front.title: Tusken Raider
front.gametext: While at Podrace Arena, if opponent just placed race destiny on their Podracer, once per turn may use 3 Force to 'shoot' (no other Tusken Raiders may 'shoot' this turn.) Draw destiny. If destiny > 3, place race destiny in opponent's hand.
front.lore: Tusken Raiders are constantly taking bets to see who can hit the most Podracers on the Boonta Eve racetrack.

front.title: Tusken Raider
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Power +1 if another non-unique Tusken Raider present. If you have four or more non-unique Tusken Raiders present, your total power here is +2.
front.lore: 'Sand People.' Ride banthas. Wield gaderffi (gaffi) sticks. Wear eye protectors and breath masks. Violent, nomadic, desert survival experts. 'Urrrg! Ur Ur Uur!'

front.title: Tusken Scavengers
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to draw destiny. If destiny < the number of Tusken Raiders on table, you may scavenge (search through) the opponent's Used Pile. All vehicles, weapons or devices you find there are lost.
front.lore: 'Sand People always ride single file to hide their numbers.' They frequently attack strangers as they scavenge for useful equipment. Looted Luke's landspeeder.

combo: Tusken Scavengers + Skrilling

front.title: •Twi'lek Advisor
front.gametext: USED: Use 3 Force to search your Reserve Deck and take one Effect of any kind into hand; reshuffle.  STARTING: Deploy from your Reserve Deck one Effect which has no deploy cost; reshuffle. Place Interrupt in the Lost Pile.
front.lore: 'He's no Jedi.'

front.title: •Twi'lek Advisor (V)
front.gametext: USED: Use 3 Force to deploy a unique (•) alien (for free) from hand or Used Pile; reshuffle.  STARTING: Take into hand and/or deploy from Reserve Deck up to three Effects of any kind with 'Jabba' in lore or game text on table from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Place this Interrupt in Reserve Deck.
front.lore: 'He's no Jedi.'

front.title: •Twi'lek Advisor (V)
front.gametext: If Audience Chamber on table, deploy Passenger Deck or a pit from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Deploy an alien leader or Twi'lek to Audience Chamber from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: 'He's no Jedi.'

front.title: Twin Suns Of Tatooine / Well Trained In The Jedi Arts
front.gametext: Twin Suns Of Tatooine:Deploy Tatooine system and a non-Jabba's Palace Tatooine battleground site. {For} remainder of game, you may not deploy Jabba's Palace sites or Sandwhirl. {While} this side up, once per turn, may use 1 Force to deploy a Tatooine battleground site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. {Flip} this card if you control two Tatooine battleground sites (at least one with a Dark Jedi) and occupy Tatooine system, and opponent controls no Tatooine sites.Well Trained In The Jedi Arts:{While} this side up, once per game,may deploy Tatooine Occupation from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once during your control phase, may peek at the top two cards of your Reserve Deck; take one into hand and shuffle Reserve Deck. For opponent to move a character or vehicle from same site as your Dark Jedi requires +1 Force. {Flip} this card if opponent controls more Tatooine sites than you.

back.title: Twin Suns Of Tatooine / Well Trained In The Jedi Arts
back.gametext: Twin Suns Of Tatooine:Deploy Tatooine system and a non-Jabba's Palace Tatooine battleground site. {For} remainder of game, you may not deploy Jabba's Palace sites or Sandwhirl. {While} this side up, once per turn, may use 1 Force to deploy a Tatooine battleground site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. {Flip} this card if you control two Tatooine battleground sites (at least one with a Dark Jedi) and occupy Tatooine system, and opponent controls no Tatooine sites.Well Trained In The Jedi Arts:{While} this side up, once per game,may deploy Tatooine Occupation from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once during your control phase, may peek at the top two cards of your Reserve Deck; take one into hand and shuffle Reserve Deck. For opponent to move a character or vehicle from same site as your Dark Jedi requires +1 Force. {Flip} this card if opponent controls more Tatooine sites than you.

front.title: •Tyrant
front.gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. When using Tractor Beam, adds 1 to destiny draw.
front.lore: Assigned to Admiral Ozzel's Death Squadron. Attempted to capture Rebel starships fleeing the Hoth system.

combo: Tyrant + Imperial Helmsman Draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

front.title: •U-3PO (Yoo-Threepio)
front.gametext: Deploy on opponent's side as an Undercover spy (except that if present during a battle at a site, adds its power to Light Side). If spy's 'cover is broken,' the above game text is canceled and Light Side may use as if stolen.
front.lore: This protocol droid served in the House of Alderaan's Diplomatic Corps. Imperials altered its programming for espionage, making the droid an unwitting spy for the Empire.

combo: U-3PO (Yoo-Threepio) + Program Trap
U-3PO (Yoo-Threepio) + Nevar Yalnal
U-3PO (Yoo-Threepio) + E Chu Ta

front.title: Ubrikkian 9000 Z001
front.gametext: May add 1 driver and 2 passengers. May move as a 'react.'
front.lore: Enclosed repulsorlift landspeeder. Micro-thrusters placed around spherical hull. Seats three. Extremely maneuverable. Top speed of 160 km per hour.

front.title: •Ugloste
front.gametext: Power +2 at Trash Compactor, Droid Junkheap, Incinerator or Carbonite Chamber. Functions as a leader if present with another Ugnaught. Where present, other Ugnaughts are forfeit +2 and double their bonus to Carbon-Freezing destiny.
front.lore: Ugnaught assigned to determine how to use carbon-freezing on humans. Placed in charge or the Ugnaught workers on Cloud City. Formerly enslaved by humans.

front.title: Ugnaught
front.gametext: When at Carbonite Chamber, cumulatively adds 1 to each Carbon- Freezing destiny draw. During your control phase, may lose 1 Force from hand to search your Lost Pile and take one weapon or device into hand.
front.lore: Cheap manual labor from Gentes in the Anoat system. Make up Cloud City's second largest population. Responsible for maintenance and menial chores throughout the city.

combo: Ugnaughts + Prepare The Chamber + Carbonite Chamber Console + Ugloste A guaranteed freezing draw.

Ugnaughts + weapons + bounty hunters. These guys can serve as the ultimate armorers. You don't have to worry about hanging on to combinations of weapon cards until you actually have the warriors to use them.

front.title: •Umpass-stay
front.gametext: Power +2 at a Jabba's Palace site. Each of your other musicians at same site is power +2 and immune to attrition < 3. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Klatooinian born into slavery to Desilijic Hutt clan on Shawti. Musician. Works as a spy for Jabba at his desert fortress while playing drums for visiting bands.

combo: Umpass-Stay + Nevar Yalnal

front.title: Uncertain Is The Future
front.gametext: Use 3 Force. Each player places hand onto Reserve Deck (if possible), then places Used Pile onto Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Each player then draws cards from Reserve Deck equal to the number of cards just placed from hand onto Reserve Deck (if any).
front.lore: Even a Jedi cannot always foresee future events.

front.title: Undercover
front.gametext: Deploy on your spy at a site and cross spy to opponent's side. Spy is now Undercover. During your deploy phase, may voluntarily 'break cover' (lose Effect) if at a site. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Empire maintains a network of spies attempting to infiltrate the Rebel Alliance or misinform their operatives.

front.title: Undercover (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on your spy at a site. Spy is now Undercover. During your control phase, may take one Informant into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. At same and related sites, opponent's [Permanent Weapon] weapon destiny draws are -1 (-2 if targeting this character). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The Empire maintains a network of spies attempting to infiltrate the Rebel Alliance or misinform their operatives.

front.title: •Unexpected Interruption
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to search your Reserve Deck and take one Interrupt into hand. Shuffle, cut and replace.
front.lore: 'Sir! Sir! I've isolated the reverse power flux coupling!'

front.title: •Unexpected Interruption (V)
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated, target an opponent's female non-droid character present with Xizor. Draw destiny. Target excluded from battle and adds her power to Xizor's for remainder of turn if destiny +2 > target's ability.
front.lore: 'Sir! Sir! I've isolated the reverse power flux coupling!'

front.title: •Unsalvageable
front.gametext: During your turn, target an opponent's unpiloted starship present at a system, or an opponent's unpiloted vehicle. Target is lost (along with any cards aboard it). OR Cancel Hyper Escape, Power Pivot, or Out Of Commission.
front.lore: With mounting pressure from superior forces, the Rebellion sometimes has to abandon its crippled equipment in order to simply get its personnel out alive.

front.title: •URoRRuR'R'R
front.gametext: Deploys only on on Tatooine. When at same site as another Tusken Raider, may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Leader of a Tusken Raider tribe. Unafraid of machines. Skilled hunter and marksman. Raids moisture farms for water. Roams the Jundland Wastes in search of unwary travelers.

front.title: •URoRRuR'R'R (V)
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. While with another Tusken Raider: opponent's weapon destiny draws here are -2; once per turn, may place a card from hand on Force Pile to draw top card of Reserve Deck; and other Tusken Raiders here are forfeit +4.
front.lore: Leader of a Tusken Raider tribe. Unafraid of machines. Skilled hunter and marksman. Raids moisture farms for water. Roams the Jundland Wastes in search of unwary travelers.

front.title: •URoRRuR'R'R's Bantha
front.gametext: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability = 1/2. Adds 1 to power of each of your Tusken Raiders and other banthas present. When ridden by URoRRuR'R'R, adds one battle destiny.
front.lore: Raised by RR'uruurr for personal use by URoRRuR'R'R. Alpha male of his bantha herd. Has trampled many Jawas. Nicknamed 'Rrr'ur'R.

front.title: •URoRRuR'R'R's Bantha (V)
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability = 1/2. While URoRRuR'R'R aboard, adds one battle destiny. During your deploy phase, may deploy one URoRRuR'R'R here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Raised by RR'uruurr for personal use by URoRRuR'R'R. Alpha male of his bantha herd. Has trampled many Jawas. Nicknamed 'Rrr'ur'R.

front.title: •URoRRuR'R'R's Hunting Rifle
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on URoRRuR'R'R or Chief Bast, 3 on your non-droid character. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Subtract 1 if targeting a character. Add 2 if targeting a creature. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Owning a hunting rifle is an important status symbol in Tusken culture. URoRRuR'R'R scavenged this weapon from a starship wreck near Anchorhead.

front.title: •Ur'Ru'r
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. While at Tusken Canyon, Jundland Wastes or same Tatooine site as UroRRuR'R'R, adds 2 to each of your battle destiny draws at Tatooine sites where you have a Tusken Raider.
front.lore: Fierce Tusken Raider. Ransacks homes and moisture farms on the borders of Mos Espa.

front.title: •Ur'Ru'r (V)
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. During your deploy phase, if with URoRRuR'R'R, may deploy a weapon with 'Tusken' in lore here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle; your weapon destiny draws for such weapons are +2. During your deploy phase, may move Ur'Ru'r as a regular move.
front.lore: Fierce Tusken Raider. Ransacks homes and moisture farms on the borders of Mos Espa.

front.title: Utinni!
front.gametext: If one of your Jawas is at the same location as any Utinni Effect, 'steal' that Utinni Effect into your hand, to use or lose as your own. OR Cancel any Interrupt or Effect with 'Jawa' in the card name.
front.lore: The Jawa who shot R2-D2 with an ionization gun called to his companions, 'Utinni!', the Jawa word for 'come here!'

cancels: Any Interrupt or Effect with 'Jawa' in the card name

front.title: Utinni! (V)
front.gametext: Take an Utinni Effect into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Take a non-unique and/or a unique (•) Jawa into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: The Jawa who shot R2-D2 with an ionization gun called to his companions, 'Utinni!', the Jawa word for 'come here!'

front.title: •Vader
front.gametext: Must deploy on Death Star, but may move elsewhere. May not be deployed if two or more of opponent's unique (•) characters on table. If in a losing battle, draw destiny. If destiny > 4, 'choke' (lose) one Imperial present (your choice).
front.lore: Sought to extinguish all Jedi. Former student of Obi-Wan Kenobi. Seduced by the dark side of the Force.

combo: Vader + I Have You Now Add one battle destiny (two if Rebel is Luke) if a Dark Jedi and a Rebel with ability > 2 are involved in the same battle.
Vader + Force Field Cancels an attempt to target a Dark Jedi with a character weapon.

front.title: •Vader (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots.  Jedi are defense value -1 and forfeit -2 at same and related sites.  During battle, if you are about to draw a card for weapon or battle destiny, may instead use an Interrupt of destiny < 4 from hand.  Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Sought to extinguish all Jedi. Former student of Obi-Wan Kenobi. Seduced by the dark side of the Force.

front.title: •Vader's Anger
front.gametext: USED: Add 1 to your just-drawn lightsaber weapon destiny draw.  LOST: If a duel was just initiated, place the top card of your Used Pile on top of your Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Anger and aggression fuel the dark side of the Force.

front.title: •Vader's Anger (V)
front.gametext: During any move phase, initiate an epic duel between Vader and a Jedi present with him. Both players draw two destiny and add power. Loser (lowest total) is placed in Used Pile (if Epic Duel on table, Lost Pile instead), losing player loses 2 Force (cannot be reduced), and winning player may retrieve 2 Force.
front.lore: Anger and aggression fuel the dark side of the Force.

front.title: •Vader's Anger (V)
front.gametext: For remainder of turn, opponent may not cancel your lightsaber weapon (or 'choke') destiny draws. OR If Vader in battle alone, your total battle destiny is +1 for each character in battle. OR Cancel It's A Trap!
front.lore: Anger and aggression fuel the dark side of the Force.

front.title: •Vader's Bionic Limbs
front.gametext: Deploy on [Vader] Vader.  Vader is landspeed +1.  If Vader about to be lost before the damage segment, he is instead 'hit.'  During battle, may target one opponent's character present.  Draw destiny. Target 'choked' (lost) if destiny > ability. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Darth Vader often used physical means of 'persuasion' to get information. Captain Antilles of Tantive IV chose to die rather than reveal the location of the stolen Death Star plans.

front.title: •Vader's Bounty
front.gametext: Deploy on a Rebel of ability > 2. If subsequently captured, seized by a bounty hunter and then transferred to a prison where Vader is present, retrieve Force equal to character's forfeit (+4 if Luke) and lose Effect. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'We would be honored if you would join us.'

front.title: •Vader's Bounty (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Slave I is destiny +2 when drawn for weapon or battle destiny. During battle: while non-[Reflections III] Boba Fett with Vader, neither may be excluded or lost until the damage segment, and may place this Effect in Lost Pile to make Boba Fett's total weapon destiny +3.
front.lore: 'We would be honored if you would join us.'

front.title: •Vader's Cape
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on one of your Imperials or aliens. Immune to attrition < 5. When in battle, adds 1 to each of your battle destiny draws.
front.lore: A symbol of the Dark Lord of the Sith, and of the seductive power of the dark side.

front.title: •Vader's Cape (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on [Vader] Vader.  Vader moves (using landspeed) for free.  While with a Jedi or Skywalker, Vader is defense value and immunity to attrition +2, and his weapon destiny draws are +1.  During a duel (or lightsaber combat) opponent initiates, Vader's destiny draws are +1. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: A symbol of the Dark Lord of the Sith, and of the seductive power of the dark side.

front.title: •Vader's Custom TIE
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. If Vader is pilot, Custom TIE is immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: TIE advanced x1 prototype. First of a limited production run leading to the development of the TIE Interceptor. At Vader's insistence a hyperdrive was installed.

pulledBy: Short Range Fighters & Watch Your Back!

front.title: •Vader's Custom TIE (V)
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Vader deploys -2 aboard. While Vader piloting, immune to attrition < 5, and during battle, may cancel game text of a passenger (or pilot of ability < 4) here.
front.lore: TIE advanced x1 prototype. First of a limited production run leading to the development of the TIE Interceptor. At Vader's insistence a hyperdrive was installed.

pulledBy: Short Range Fighters & Watch Your Back!

front.title: •Vader's Cybernetic Enhancements
front.gametext: Deploy on [Vader] Vader.  Vader may move as a 'react.'  Your battle destiny draws here are +1.  Opponent's cards deployed on Vader are canceled.  If Vader about to be placed in Lost Pile, may lose 4 Force to take him (and a lightsaber he was armed with, if possible) into hand. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Users of the Force can mysteriously manipulate their own physiology and psychology. Control allows rapid healing and provides some immunity to pain, poison and disease.

front.title: •Vader's Eye
front.gametext: If Vader is defending a battle alone at a site, add 1 to power and add one battle destiny. OR If any other Imperial with ability > 2 is defending a battle alone at a site, add one battle destiny.
front.lore: Darth Vader's armored mask and life-support system provide him with extraordinary physical protection in duels and battles, in addition to his Dark Jedi combat skill.

front.title: •Vader's Helmet
front.gametext: Deploy on [Vader] Vader.  When Vader moves to same site as a Jedi or Skywalker, opponent loses 1 Force.  If Obi-Wan's Journal here, may place it on bottom of opponent's Lost Pile.  While with opponent's character of ability > 4, Vader is power +1 and draws two battle destiny if not able to otherwise. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'If once you start down the dark path, forever will it dominate your destiny. Consume you it will, as it did Obi-Wan's apprentice.'

front.title: •Vader's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on Vader. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Custom-built by Darth Vader. After the Clone Wars, he wielded this weapon while hunting down the last of the Jedi. Cuts through almost anything except another lightsaber blade.

pulledBy: I Will Finish What You Started

front.title: •Vader's Mask
front.gametext: Deploy on [Vader] Vader.  During your battle phase, may cancel this Effect to allow Vader to make a regular move.  In order for opponent's character to move away from here using landspeed, opponent must first lose 1 Force.  While defending a battle at opponent's site, Vader is power +2 and immune to attrition. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Darth Vader's armored mask and life-support system provide him with extraordinary physical protection in duels and battles, in addition to his Dark Jedi combat skill.

front.title: •Vader's Obsession
front.gametext: During your move phase, if Vader moves to Luke's site from an adjacent site, begin a duel between them. Each adds two destiny to power. Winner retrieves lost Force equal to the difference. Loser loses same amount of Force, plus the character.
front.lore: Vader sought to hunt down and destroy all Jedi. After completing the circle with Obi-Wan, he turned his attention to the young Skywalker.

front.title: •Vader's Personal Shuttle
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2. Moves for free. While Vader aboard, opponent must have ability > 5 to draw battle destiny at same system. May not Talon Roll.
front.lore: Shuttle Customized transport of Lord Vader. Employs advanced sensor jamming gear. Modified with enhanced tactical displays constructed to the Dark Lord's specifications.

front.title: •Vader's Personal Shuttle (V)
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 4 passengers. Vader deploys -3 aboard. While Vader piloting at a battleground, maneuver +2 and you lose no Force to Uncontrollable Fury or You Must Confront Vader.
front.lore: Shuttle Customized transport of Lord Vader. Employs advanced sensor jamming gear. Modified with enhanced tactical displays constructed to the Dark Lord's specifications.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Nate Meeker - World Champion 2006)

front.title: •Vader's Personal Shuttle (V)
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 4 passengers. Vader deploys -3 aboard. While Vader piloting at a battleground, maneuver +2 and you lose no Force to Uncontrollable Fury or You Must Confront Vader.
front.lore: Shuttle Customized transport of Lord Vader. Employs advanced sensor jamming gear. Modified with enhanced tactical displays constructed to the Dark Lord's specifications.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Nate Meeker - World Champion 2006)
pulledBy: Short Range Fighters & Watch Your Back!
cancels: You lose no force to Uncontrollable Fury or You Must Confront Vader

front.title: •Vanee
front.gametext: Deploys -3 to a site with 'Vader' in game text. Once during your turn, may activate 1 Force. Once per game, may take a card with 'Vader' in title into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Vedain
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. During your control phase, if at a Jabba's Palace site, may use 2 Force to make a 'wager'. Both players draw one destiny. Player with lower number loses 1 Force.
front.lore: Kajain'sa'Nikto scout. Sold by his family into slavery to Jabba. Gambler. Plays sabacc with his fellow Nikto.

cards.set: Empire Strikes Back Introductory Two Player Game

front.title: •Veers
front.gametext: Must deploy on Hoth, but may move elsewhere. May not be deployed if three or more of opponent's unique ( •) characters on table. Snowtroopers at same site are forfeit +1.
front.lore: General of the AT-AT assault armor division sent by Darth Vader to crush the Rebellion on Hoth. Cold and ruthless.

front.title: •Veers (V)
front.gametext: Add 3 to power of anything he pilots. Leader. Once per turn, may reveal from hand to / 6th marker or Blizzard 1 to Hoth. Deploys free aboard Blizzard 1. While piloting Blizzard 1, adds one destiny to total power.
front.lore: General of the AT-AT assault armor division sent by Darth Vader to crush the Rebellion on Hoth. Cold and ruthless.

front.title: •Veers (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Leader. Once per turn, may reveal from hand to deploy 6th Marker or Blizzard 1 to Hoth from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Deploys free aboard Blizzard 1. While piloting Blizzard 1, adds one destiny to total power.
front.lore: General of the AT-AT assault armor division sent by Darth Vader to crush the Rebellion on Hoth. Cold and ruthless.

front.title: Vehicle Mine
front.gametext: Deploy at same exterior site as your mining droid. 'Explodes' if starfighter (use 5 as defense value) or non-creature vehicle deploys or moves to or across same site. Draw destiny. Target lost if destiny +2 > defense value. Vehicle Mine is also lost.
front.lore: Launches and detonates when activated by a passing metallic mass or the repulsorlift field of an approaching speeder. The shrapnel can hit even the quickest craft.

front.title: •Velken Tezeri
front.gametext: When at a site you control, allows your Seekers to deploy free there. Also allows your Seekers to move for free and to ignore any or all potential target(s) whenever you choose.
front.lore: Assigned by Jabba to work with Hermi Odle. Former technician for the Empire. Developed a method to remotely control seekers. Plotting to kill Jabba.

front.title: •Velken Tezeri (V)
front.gametext: Smuggler. May not be attacked. Velken may not target Luke with weapons. Once per game, when deployed to a battleground, opponent must use or lose 2 Force. While present at a pit, may add 1 to Force drains here, and Sarlacc is ferocity +1.
front.lore: Assigned by Jabba to work with Hermi Odle. Former technician for the Empire. Developed a method to remotely control seekers. Plotting to kill Jabba.

front.title: •Velken Tezeri (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. Smuggler. While present at a pit, adds 1 to your Force drains here. Unless 'hit' (or Gamall Wironicc here), your other characters here may not be targeted by lightsabers. May not target Luke with weapons.
front.lore: Assigned by Jabba to work with Hermi Odle. Former technician for the Empire. Developed a method to remotely control seekers. Plotting to kill Jabba.

front.title: •Vengeance
front.gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 1 vehicle and 6 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Your TIE/lns are forfeit +2 at same location. Power +2 at Nal Hutta.
front.lore: Part of Darth Vader's Death Squadron. Support vessel for the fleet's starfighters. Cargo areas converted into hangar space for additional TIE fighters.

combo: Vengeance + Imperial Helmsman Draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
